Now he requests a loan of 2,800 TJS (US$825) for business support and to widen the existing sales outlet .

loans.use: business support and to widen the existing outlet

texts.en: Askarjon P. lives in Khujand. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006. He recommends himself as a serious executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. He is engaged in commercial services and trade. He has a business in sweets selling (sweets, sugar, condensed milk, etc). Mr.P. works in Panjshanbe bazaar, where his trade outlet is located. He has a wide assortment and permanent clients. He is experienced in the business. Working in Panjshanbe bazaar he has tough competition, which is why he wants to widen the existing assortment with a New Year goods purchase. Now he requests a loan of 1,100 TJS (US$325) for business support.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida U. lives in Khujand. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and recommends herself as a serious executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She is engaged in commercial services and trade. She has a business in sweets selling (sweets, sugar, condensed milk, etc). Mrs.U. works in  the Panjshanbe bazaar, where her trade outlet is located. She has a wide assortment and permanent clients because she is very polite and well wishing. She is experienced in the business. Working in Panjshanbe bazaar she has stiff competition, which is why she wants to widen the existing assortment with a New Year goods purchase (gift sets). Now Mrs.U. requests a loan of 1,000 TJS  (US$300) for business development by the New Year good purchase. It permits her to increase the family's income and to plan further business modernization.

loans.use: business support and purchase goods for the New Year

loans.name: Umarboi

texts.en: Umarboi U. lives in B.Gafurov Rayon; he is divorced and has 2 children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005 and recommends himself as a serious executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. Loan sums are permanently increased to those who show business stability and an income increase. He is engaged in commercial and trade service. Mr. U. has a business in rice selling. He has a straight supplier that allows him to sell rice at a price that is lower than the bazaar price. He is very polite, which is why he has permanent clients who want to buy only his goods. Umarboi U. is very experienced in the business, but he has tough competition, which is why he wants to widen the existing assortment of goods. Now Mr. Umarboi U. requests a loan of 1,600 TJS (US$475) for business development and to widen the assortment of goods.

loans.use: business development and to wide the assortment of goods

texts.en: Alim is single, 25 years old and lives in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan.  Alim has been in the taxi business for 2 years. Now he needs a loan of $850 to buy spare parts for improving his taxi and business.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en: Rano U. lives in Yova; she is married and has 2 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004 and recommends herself as a serious executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. Loan sums are permanently increased to those who show business stability and an income increase. She is engaged in commercial and trade service. Mrs. U. has a business in egg selling. She works with clients of different income levels. She is very polite, which is why she has repeat customers who want to buy only her goods. Rano U. is very experienced in the business but  has stiff competition, which is why she wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods. Now Mrs. Rano U. requests a loan of 1,000 TJS (US$300)  for business development and to widen the assortment.

loans.use: business development and to widen the assortment

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea M. is 40 years old and lives with her three children in Bathambong province, Cambodia. Her husband passed away many years ago so she covers all her family’s expenses by running a stand at an open air market selling fish and earns around $5/day. Mrs. Chea M. is humbly requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her business’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation

texts.ru:
Djamshed is 20. After he graduated from high school, he started helping his uncle with his business. A year later, after he got sufficient experience, he decided to open a business and sell mobile phones with his former classmates. Currently, he is trading cell phones and expanding his business.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Джамшеду 20 лет, после того как он окончил школу его дядя взял к себе на Совместное предприятие, он помогал ему в работе. Через год набравшись опыта, он с одноклассником решил заняться бизнесом по продажи сотовых трубок. Сейчас он торгует мобильные телефоны и расширяет свое дело

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Mrs. Chheng L., 37, is a mother of five children and lives in Bathambong province, Cambodia. She runs a stand at a busy market selling desserts and makes about $5/day. Her husband works at a hospital making about $3 each day and four of her children are enrolled in school. Mrs. Chheng L. would like to expand her business by buying one of her children another stand at the market to sell desserts like her.

loans.use: To open a new stand for one of her children to sell desserts.

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Mr. Lach C., 34, is married with four children and lives with his wife in Bathambong province Cambodia. He works as a motor-taxi driver, making around $3 each day. His wife works selling grocery products in her community, making about $5 per day. One of her children is self employed as a motor-taxi driver and the rest are enrolled in school. Mr. Lach C. hopes to use this loan to purchase a new motorcycle to replace his old one, which frequently needs repairs. He believes the new motor-bike will save him and his family much more money. He will use another part of the loan to purchase more grocery products for his wife to meet her customer demands. ( His wife is pictured with her grocery stand while Mr. Lach C. was on his way to operate his business).

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to operate a business.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mrs. Sek R., 42, is married with six children and lives in Bathambong province, Cambodia. She is a housewife while her husband works as a carpenter making tables, chairs, beds, cabinets and other wooden furniture items, making on average around $4/day. One of her children works as a waiter; another is a motor-taxi driver and the rest attend school. Mrs. Sek R. hopes to use this loan to purchase more carpentR. tools and other supplies for her husband to expand his products.

loans.use: To purchase more carpentry tools and other supplies for her husband to expand his products.

loans.name: Khin

texts.en: Mrs. Khin S. Neang,39, is married with four school-aged children and lives in Bathambong province, Cambodia. She is a housewife cooking food for her family, while her husband works as a carpenter, making tables, chairs, beds, cabinets and other wooden furniture, making on average around $10/day. Mrs. Khin S. Neang hopes to use this loan to purchase more carpentry tools and other supplies for her husband to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more carpentry tools for her husband to expand his inventory.

texts.en: Irada (her brother is pictured) was born in 1967. She and her brother sell apples and dates. They have been in this business for 4 years. Now Irada needs a loan of $850 to buy additional fruits for to increase their  sales.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn S., 46, is a widow and has two children. She runs a booth selling fish, pork, beef and fresh vegetables at Phsar Tam Nakloung market, making about $5/day. One of her children is employed at 
Siem Reap province, the other is living with her and is a student. Mrs. Morm S. plans to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her business transportation and use the remainder of the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business transportation.

loans.name: Bang

texts.en: Mrs. Bang T., 32, is a mother of two little kids and sells fruit at a busy market earning about $5/day. Her husband is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver and typically earns around $5 each day. Mrs. Bang T. humbly request a loan to expand her inventory by adding more fruits to meet her growing customer demands. She believes this will raise her standard of living. ( Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Bang T. is unavailable).

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more fruits.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em N., 68, is a widow and lives with her two children in Bathambong province, Cambodia. She is a housewife.  Her two children cover all the expenses by working as fishermen. Recently, Mrs. Em N. requests a loan to purchase fishing tools for her children and use the remainder to buy a motorcycle to transport their fish to market.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools for her children and use the remainder to buy a motorcycle to transport their fish to market

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mawussé A. is 38 and a married mother of four children. She is the owner and manager of a small roadside restaurant located next to a photography studio. She has been running this business for ten years, and she earns enough income to help pay her family’s expenses and help her younger sisters, who are in apprenticeships. With this loan, she would like to increase the size of her restaurant and make it cleaner and better ventilated so that she can attract more customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Mawussé A. est agée de 38 ans , mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est propriétaire et gérante d'un petit restaurant installé au bord de la route à coté d'un studio de photo.Elle exerce cette activité depuis 10 ans et lui procure des revenues pour contribuer aux charges familliales et aider ses petites soeures qui sont en formation. Avec cet emprunt elle désire agrandir et rendre le cadre du restaurant plus propre et plus aéré afin d'attirer plus de la clientèle.

loans.name: Neak

texts.en: Mrs. Neak S. M. 46, is a mother of three married children and lives with her husband in Bathambong province, Cambodia. She and her husband sell fish at a busy market earning around $10/day. This couple hopes to use this loan to expand their inventory by purchasing more fish to meet their growing customer demands.

loans.use: To expand their inventory by purchasing more fish to meet their growing customer demands

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.en: Abdulla (his brother is pictured) was born in 1982.  He has worked as a lathe operator (a lathe is a machine for shaping a piece of material, such as wood or metal) for 2 years along with his brother. He is single and lives in Khachmaz town. Now Abdulla is  requesting a loan of $850 to buy the necessary materials for improving his business

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials for improving his business

loans.name: Ma

texts.en: Mrs. Ma N., 37, sells fish at an open air market earning around $4 each day. Her husband is employed by a private company as a driver making about $6 each day and three of her children are married and the other two are students. Mrs. Ma N. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her business’s transportation and the leftover of the money is to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her business’s transportation and the leftover of the money is to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Ma

texts.en: Mrs. N. Ma, 28, is a housewife with two little kids. To service in her family’s expenses, her husband works driving a taxi, earning about $10 each day. Mrs. N. Ma has humbly requested for a loan to replace her husband’s old ruined taxi, which needs habitual repairs and wastes her family a lot of money. With a new car, she believes it will increase her family’s savings and raise their standard of living. ( Her husband is pictured because Mrs. N. Ma is unavailable).

loans.use: To purchase a new taxi to replace his old ruined one.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru:
Mukaddas has been working at a Beauty Salon as a barber for 2 years. She has 2 children. Before she worked at a store. She will use her loan to purchase accessories for hair stylists such as sets of scissors, hair dryer, and hairspray. She anticipates a lot of customers since a quite a few people seek her services before and for the New Year's Day, which is widely celebrated in Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Мукаддас работает в саоллне красоты парикмахером. У нее двое детей. Ее деятельность длится второй год. До салона она работала в магазина. Кредит она получила для того что бы приобрести парикмахерские аксессуары(ножныцы, фне , лак для волос и т. п.).Так как перед новым годом многие обращяются в салон что бы выглядеть лучше.

loans.use: Purchase of accessories for hair stylists

loans.name: Mukaddam

texts.en: Mukaddam I. lives in B.Gafurov, Tajikistan; she is married and has 4 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007, and she recommends herself as a serious executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She is engaged in commercial and trade service. Mrs. I. is engaged in the business of  selling children's clothing. She has a wide assortment and  works with customers of different income levels. She is very polite, which is why she has repeat clients who want to buy only her goods. She is very experienced in the business. But she has stiff competition in the sector, which is why she wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods. Now Mrs. I. requests a loan of 1,400 TJS (US$425) to import new styles  to develop the existing business. She wants to widen the business to increase her family income, which allows her children to get a good education.

loans.use: to import new clothing styles for business development

loans.name: Kandy

texts.en: Mrs. Kandy Y., 25, sells womens clothes at an open-air market and typically earns around $6/day. Her husband is employed as a teacher, earning about $4 per day. Mrs. Kandy Y. has two little children who are too young to attend school. Because of her growing customer demands, Mrs. Kandy Y. has recently applied for a loan to expand her inventory to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase fashionable clothes to meet her clients' needs.

texts.en: Khanim (her husband is pictured) was born in 1957 and is the mother of 3 children.  Khanim breeds sheep to sell. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy 10 additional sheep for improving her business.

texts.ru:
Murodjon lives with his mother and sells mobile phones on a market. His mother works as a teacher at a local school. He came to MicroInvest because he desperately needed money to purchase additional inventory and increase the assortment of his goods. With the income that he earns, he helps his mother.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Муродджон живет один с матерью, он продает мобильные телефоны на рынке. Его мать работает в школе преподавателем. Ему срочно понадобились деньги, занять не у кого. Для этого он обратился в Микроинвест. Теперь он может купить на полученные деньги товар, увеличить ассортимент. Доход которую он получает , помогает матери.

texts.en: Nasiba A. lives in Khijand; she is married and has a child. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007, and she recommended herself as a serious executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. Loan sums are permanently increased to those that show business stability and an income increase. She is engaged in commercial and trade service. Mrs. A. has a business in fruit selling (bananas, pears, apples, etc). She has a straight supplier that allows her to work with clients of different income levels. She is very polite, which is why she has repeat customers. Nasiba A. is very experienced in the business, but she has stiff competition in the sector, which is why she wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods. Now Mrs. Nasiba A. requests a loan of 1,400 TJS (US$425) for business development and to widen her assortment by purchasing new goods.

Rakhila is 48 years old and is a widow with 2 children. Rakhila lives with her children in Khudat town.  She has owned her own cafe for one year.  She cooks national dishes such as dolma, plov, khingal for her clients. Now she needs a loan of $600 to further develop her business and buy new kitchen appliances. Her goal is to increase her incomes in order to meet the demands of her family.

Nargiz (her sister is pictured) is 36 years old and is a mother of 3 children. She lives with her family in Khachmaz region. 4 years ago she started a cattle breeding business with her sister. Now she and her sister need a loan of $1200 to buy 2 calves for increasing their cattle breeding operations.

Alam has worked as a taxi driver for 2 years. Alam  is 42 years old, married and has 2 children. The M. family lives in Khachmaz town. Now Alam needs a loan of $600 to repair his car for improving his business.

Aydin is 41 years old, married and has two children. He lives in Khachmaz town with his family. Aydin strated his business (selling foodstuffs) 4 years ago. Now he needs a loan of $475 to buy foodstuffs to sell in order to increase his income.

Elshad is 47 years old, married and has 2 children. The M. family lives in Khachmaz town. Elshad buys chickens and raises them for sale. He has run this business for 4 years.  Now he needs a loan of  $475 to  buy  hens and chicken for increasing his income.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is divorced with one child. She lives in Ordzhonikidze and sells plastic bags and purses in the central city market. Galina has a wide assortment of inventory and a variety of sale offers. Demand for this type of merchandise is consistent which creates good potential for the future. Galina has been in this business for 4 years. Presently, her income is about $600 per month.

Galina is hoping to open a new vending spot and increase her turnover capital. That is why she’s requesting a loan of $1200 to start working on this business project. One of her long-term plans is to open a wholesale business, selling plastic items to smaller entrepreneurs at affordable prices. We believe Galina’s perseverance, management skills and enthusiasm will help her achieve her goals and succeed in business.

loans.use: To open a new vending spot

texts.en:
Olga is married and has a grown son. She and her family live in Pavlograd. Olga lost her previous job due to downsizing so she decided to start her own business. Today Olga owns a small business selling men’s shirts and sweaters in the central city market. Her prices are relatively low. Olga recently changed the type of inventory she sells in her kiosk. She used to sell sportswear. Olga has been working in the market for about 12 years. Currently, her turnover capital is about $5600 and her weekly income is about $100-120.

Olga is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase 50 men’s sweaters. She is hoping to continue expanding her trade and would like to open one more vending facility in the market. Olga is a very honest, client-friendly, and hard-working entrepreneur. She has many loyal customers. We believe Olga’s personal qualities and ability to handle business challenges will help her succeed and repay this loan on time.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with two children. She and her family live in Pavlograd. Yelena works in the central market selling women’s sweaters, pants and skirts. She owns her own vending facility. Yelena has been in this trade for 11 years. Currently, she has about $7000 in turnover capital. Her weekly income is about $80-100.

Yelena’s daughter got married and would like to live separately from her parents with her husband. Yelena wants to help her daughter and son-in-law buy their own apartment. She works hard to make her dream come true and have enough savings to make an investment in her daughter’s family life. Yelena is now requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase 30 sweaters and 40 pairs of pants for retail sale. She is hoping to expand her business and start selling men’s outer wear too.

loans.use: To purchase 30 sweaters and 40 pairs of pants

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 39 years old. He has 2 children and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. Ali is a carpenter. He needs 1000$ to buy material for his business. Ali is providing for his family and is planning to make a new bedroom for his children. The revenue generation of his business will help him undertake this initiative.

loans.use: To buy material for his business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 46 years old. He is married and has 7 children. He lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. Hussein is a mechanic. He fixes the cars of the surrounding inhabitants. Hussein has also a partnership in a mobile phones shop. He therefore needs to buy his partner's share to fully own the business. Ali is the provider of his family. This second business will help him support his wife and children.

loans.use: To buy his partner's share (of the mobiles business)

texts.en: Samura (her brother is pictured) is 30 years old, single and lives in Khachmaz region. She has been running her farming business for 10 years.  Now she needs a loan of $475 to buy pesticides and seedlings to improve her farm. Note: Samura is not pictured for cultural reasons.

loans.name: Guleyda

texts.en: Guleyda was born in 1961and lives in Khachmaz town in Azerbaijan. Guleyda is a mother of 2 children. She has baking bread for 3 years. Now she needs a loan of $425 to buy  flour and additional products for baking bread to sell.

loans.use: To buy flour and other products for baking bread

loans.name: Gunduz

texts.ru:
Gunduz H. was born in 1982 in the village of Padarkishlak, Agsu region. He is single. For three years, Gunduz has been raising cattle. This year, he turned to NorMicro for help to finance expansion of his business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гусейнов Гюндуз родился 1982 году в село Падаркышлак Ахсуниского района. Холость . Уже три года подряд занимается скотоводством. В этом году обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал . Гюндуз хочеть расщирять свой бизнес . Семья большая, по этому ему надо помочь.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of animals

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is a trader as well as a seamstress. She is married to a tailor and has three children, ages 16, 13 and 10. She is working very hard to help her husband with the family's finances. She sells crates of eggs, soft drinks, mineral water and other provisions in addition to the clothes she sews. At the moment she is having problems with her electric sewing machine and she is planning to buy another one.

She is asking for $1,200 to add to what she has already saved towards the purchase of a new electric sewing machine, other sewing materials and goods for her shop to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a new electric sewing machine and provision for her shop.

texts.ru:
Tarlan M. was born in 1958 in Agsu region. He is married and has 3 children. For more than 10 years, Tarlan has been raising cattle. To sustain his family and increase profits from his business, Tarlan wants to purchase more cows and sheep. He turned to NorMicro for help to finance expansion of his business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Манафов Тарлан 1958 года рождения . Уроженец Ахсуниского района. Семейный, имеет троих детей. Более десяти лет занимается скотоводством. Маленкий прибыль вынуждал Тарлана купить еще коров и овец. Он обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал. Этот трудолюбивый человек надеется на кредит.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca B. is a trader who sells provisions, soft drinks and clothing materials, etc. She is married to a Rewinder and has four children, ages 22, 19, 17 and15. She is  working very hard to support her husband with the family's finances. Demand for her goods has increased and she needs to purchase more goods for her shop.

She is asking for $1,200 in additional capital to  buy more soft drinks, provisions and clothing materials.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks, provisions and clothing materials for shop.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard Kwesi A. is a trader who sells spare parts and accessories. He's single and has no children. He is focused on increasing his income. Demand for his goods is increasingly growing but he does not have enough capital to purchase more goods to meet the demand. 

He is asking for $1,200 in additional capital to buy more car parts, especially batteries and other accessories, to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary BA. is a trader who buys corn wholesale to sell. She also prepares ‘kenkey’ a native food which is in  high demand. She is a single parent of 4 children and  works very hard to support the family. She wants to increase sales in order to increase her income.

She is asking for $1,200 in additional capital to buy more corn to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more corn to meet the demand of her costumers.

texts.ru:
Hikmatullo G. is 25 years old, has a college education, is an economist by profession, is married and does not have children. After finishing university, Hikmatullo could not find a job in his profession, because there were no vacancies. He plans to use the loan to purchase young calves to feed and resell. He has been in this business for 2 years. He will sell the calves every 40-45 days and then use the earnings to purchase new calves. He will use his profits to support his family. Hikmatullo plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Гургов Хикматулло, возраст – 25 лет, образование высшее, по специальности – экономист, женат, детей не имеет. После окончания университета Хикматулло на смог найти себе работу по специальности по причине отстутсвия вакантных мест. Он, на полученнй кредит планирует приобрести молодых бычков для откормки и продажи. Этим видом деятельнсти он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. Он будет продавать скот через каждые 40-45 дней, после продажи он будет приобретать молодняк и откармливать. Заработанную прибыль он будет использовать для содержание своей семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.name: Emomali

texts.ru:
Emomali B., who is 58, is married and has 3 children. Emomali has been in the business of selling men's clothing for 3 years. For that reason, he rents a space in the market called "Kovron", in the city of Dushanbe, which is recognized as the biggest market in the country. He plans to use funds from the loan to purchase winter clothing, which he obtains directly from distributors. Because this market is visited by people from all over Tajikistan, they will have an opportunity to purchase his products at moderate prices as prices at "Kovron" are a lot lower than at other markets. Emomali plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

. Боронов Эмомали, возраст – 58 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Эмомали занимается продажей мужской одеждой в течение 3 лет, для этого он арендует торговую точку на рынке в городе Душанбе, под названием «Корвон», который является самым крупным рынком в Таджикистане на сегодняшний день. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение нового зимнего товара, который он приобретает у поставщиков. Так как на данный рынок приезжают жители со всего Таджикистана, они будут иметь возможность приобрести необходимый им товар по умеренным ценам, так как здесь цены намного ниже чем на других рынках. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of new clothes for winter season

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda A. is a trader who owns a provisions (grocery) store. She is married with two children, ages 21 and 10. Her husband works as a cashier but his income is not sufficient  to meet the family's expenses. Matilda would like to increase sales to increase income.

She is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to buy more provisions and other food supplies for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her shop.

texts.en:
Isaac K. D. is a manufacturer of both male and female shoes. He is married and has three children, ages 17, 12 and 6. His wife is a trader who owns a shop where she sells some of her husband's shoes. 
At the moment Isaac is manufacturing on a small scale. He wants to increase productivity to meet the growing demand for his products.

He is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to buy more raw materials (Bonas, Pure leather, Lining, Designing Bonas, Glue, etc.) to manufacture on a larger scale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel A. is a trader who sells electrical appliances and electrical fittings. Daniel is married to a teacher and they have two children, ages 5 and 2. His wife is working very hard to help her husband put food on the table. Daniel wants to increase his income.

He is asking for $1,200 to buy more television sets, sound systems and other electrical fittings, which are in high demand from his shop.

loans.use: To buy more television sets, sound systems and other electrical fittings.

texts.en:
Eva K. is a trader who sells cooking oil, beans, corn and other provisions. She is married to an engineer. They have 3 children ages 10, 7 and 3. Eva is working very hard to support her family’s finances. Her business is doing well.   

Eva is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to buy more cooking oil, beans, corn, and other provisions in order   to increase her sales.

loans.name: Ujamoral Massoumé Group

texts.fr:
We live on the island of Carabane, a very isolated place. Our main resource is fish, and we would like to develop our business of processing fish products and selling them in markets in cities like Dakar and Ziguinchor and in other places in Senegal. We would also like to buy and sell industrial products, which are very difficult to find in our town due to its island location. We would like to buy perishable goods (shrimp, smoked, dried and salted fish and other seafood such as oysters and shellfish), which we will process to sell in town.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Nous habitons une zone très enclavée qui est l'île de Carabane. notre principale ressource est la pêche et 

nous  voulons développer le commerce des produits de la pêche que nous transformons et allons vendre 

dans les marchés des villes comme Dakar, Ziguinchor et autres lieux du Sénégal. Il y a aussi le commerce 

des produits industiels qui sont d'accès très difficile vu notre situation géographique d'insulaire. qinsi donc, 

nous allons acheter les produits frais que nous transformerons pour les revendre en ville(crevettes; 

poissons fumés, séchés et salés et les autres fruits de mer commes les huîtres et coquillages)

loans.use: Purchase of fish products and women’s and children’s clothing

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es:
Arsenio is 47 years old and his wife, Marina, is 51. They have two sons already grown who work independently and live in the capital (Assumption).

Arsenio has been working selling craft articles such as bedspreads, hammocks and tablecloths door-to-door for over twenty-five years. His wife weaves the bedspreads by hand with cotton threads as well as attending a small grocery that they have in their house.

Thanks to their hard work and their good business sense they have managed to maintain a family and also educate their children. As a result their children are already professionals with a good life ahead of them. Today Arsenio requests a loan in order to acquire thick cotton threads of many colors for weaving more hammocks and bedspreads.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Arsenio tiene 47 años de edad y su esposa doña Marina 51, ellos tienen dos hijos varones ya mayores que trabajan en forma independiente y viven en la capital. (Asunción).

La actividad del señor Arsenio es la venta ambulante y a crédito de artículos artesanales como colchas, hamacas y manteles hace más de veinticinco años; su esposa elabora las colchas a mano con hilos de algodón además de atender una pequeña despensa que tienen en su casa.

Gracias a este trabajo y su gran vocación de emprendedor ha podido conseguir mantener una familia y además darle educación, por lo que actualmente sus hijos ya son profesionales, que tienen una vida hecha. Hoy Arsenio solicita el crédito para poder adquirir hilos gruesos de algodón de diversos colores para poder tejer mayor cantidad de hamacas y colchas.

loans.use: To buy thick cotton thread of various colors.

texts.fr:
We live on the island of Carabane, an isolated place that is difficult to get to. We work in activities linked to fishing and processing fish, making products such as smoked fish and processed shrimp, oysters and shellfish. After each round of production, we go sell our products in towns, where we buy other necessary products that we resell in our village. It is in this way that we are trying to discourage young people from fleeing to the city, and we are also helping our families pay for our children’s education. We are going to build an oven to smoke fish and a drying kiln for other types of fish we find in the local area. Our business will thus be centered on the fish product trade.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Nous habitons l'île de Carabane qui est un endroit très enclavé donc l'accès est très difficile. Ce qui nous amène à faire des activités liées à la pêche et aux produits de transformation comme le poissons fumé, la transformation de crevettes, d'huîtres et de coquillages. Après chaque production, nous allons vendre nos marchandises dans les villes et nous achetons des produits de premières nécessités que nous venoàns revendre dans notre village. C'est ainsi que nous comptons lutter contre l'exode des jeunes vers les villes et nous aidons aussi nos familles pour les frais scolaires. Nous allons construire un four pour fumer les poissons et un séchoir pour les autres types de produits halieutiques que nous trouvons dans notre environnement. Notre activité sera donc la commercialisation des produits de pêche.

loans.name: Castorina

texts.es:
Castorina lives in the neighborhood of San Vicente of Carapeguá. She is 46 years old and is a single mother. She has her own house and lives with her only son, named Ruben.

Castorina is a hard-working woman. She has worked since she was young and faced life on her own. Previously, her mother lived with her as well; however, she passed away as a result of a terminal illness. Today, Castorina manages her own business: She has a women’s, men’s and children’s clothing stall in the city’s municipal market.

She wishes that her son completes a university course so that he may access the best job opportunities. Today, she is soliciting a credit with which she will buy a larger quantity of goods like seasonal clothing for this current summer.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Castorina vive en el Barrio San Vicente de Carapeguá tiene 46 años es madre soltera tiene casa propia y vive en compañía de su único hijo llamado Rubén.

Es una mujer muy trabajadora desde muy joven trabajo y se enfrentó a la vida sola; anteriormente con ella también vivía su madre pero falleció a causa de una enfermedad terminal. Castorina hoy día administra su propio negocio, ella tiene un puesto de venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños en el mercado municipal de la ciudad.

Ella desea que su hijo culmine una carrera universitaria, y que pueda acceder a mejores oportunidades laborales. Hoy día solicita un crédito con los que comprara mayor cantidad de mercaderías como ropa de temporada para este verano que estamos viviendo.

loans.use: Purchase of T-shirts, skirts, jeans, blouses, pants, shorts, Bermudas, etc.

loans.name: Jamonoy Tey De Kacoumpa Group

texts.fr:
We are a group of women who would like to make crafts and house wares using local products. We make house wares with materials such as palm tree bark and leaves, with which we make things such as laundry baskets, breadboxes (which we sell in restaurants), mats and other types of baskets. Financing will allow us to buy a large quantity of raw materials and to train young girls in the village in the art of basket making. This will help discourage young people from fleeing to the city. It will also allow us to make brooms, which we sell in big cities in Senegal. This will be our group’s second loan, but this time it will be for a limited amount so that we will be able to create a sustainable business.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Nous sommes un groupe de femmes qui voudrais confectionner des objets d'art et d'ustensiles de maison
avec des produits locaux. Notre travail consiste à fabriquer des ustensiles de maison avec des matériaux comme le rônier et les feuilles de palmier avec lesquels nous fabricons des paniers à linge ou de rangement des paniers à pain que nous vendons dans des restaurants, des nattes et autres objets de vannerie. Le financement nous permettra de pouvoir acheter la matière première en quantité suffisante et nous permettra ainsi de pouvoir former des jeunes filles du village au métier de vannerie, contribuant ainsi à la lutte contre l'immigration des jeunes vers les villes. Cela nous permettra aussi de fabriquer des balais que nous vendons dans les grandes villes du Sénégal. Ce sera le deuxième prêt que notre groupe va recevoir, mais cette fois ci ce sera un nombre très limité, afin que le financement puisse nous permettre de créer une entreprise durable.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make crafts

texts.es:
Elena is from the Tayy Loma de Carapeguá company. She is 42 years old and has been married for 15 years. She and her husband have two small children who live with them in their own house.

Her husband is a driver of a passenger bus. She sells crafts such as bed quilts, hammocks and, more importantly, thermoses lined with engraved leather. This last item generates a good earning for her. This is because thermoses are used a lot here since one of the most typical drinks of our country is “terere” which is similar to “mate” only because it is served with really cold water.

The sale of these thermoses increases considerably in this season of the year since the summer is when there is the most demand. As a result, Elena is soliciting a credit with which she can acquire a great quantity of thermoses from a supplier who gives her a good discount.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena es de la compañía Tayy Loma de Carapeguá, ella tienen 42 años de edad esta casada hace ya 15 años y tienen dos hijos pequeños viven con ellos en una casa propia de la pareja.

Su marido es chofer de un bus de pasajeros, y ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías como colchas para cama, hamacas y especialmente termos forrados en cuero gravados. Este último le genera bastante ganancia puesto que los termos son muy utilizados acá, ya que una de las bebidas mas típicas de nuestro país es el “terere” que es parecido al mate solo que se sirve con agua bien fría.

La venta de estos termos aumenta considerablemente en esta época del año ya que en el verano es cuando hay mayor demanda de los mismos, por ello solicita un crédito con los que podrá adquirir en gran cantidad termos de un proveedor que le concederá un buen descuento.

loans.name: Eliodora

texts.es:
Eliodora is married. Her husband is named Juan Jara and they have three children, all of whom are in high school. Her husband is a farmer and she is an ambulant vendor of crafts. As a result of their work and the sacrifices they’ve made, Eliodora and her husband have their own home.

Among the things that Eliodora sells are artisanal bed covers made by hand with cotton thread that is also made by hand by the artisans in the city. Every morning, she travels through the neighborhoods, house by house, offering her products that are very well accepted.

In addition, she raises pigs and slaughters them in order to sell them. This generates a good extra income. Eliodora is soliciting a credit so that she may buy bed covers in different sizes and colors in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Eliodora es una señora casada, su marido se llama Juan Jara y tienen 3 hijos, todos cursando sus estudios secundarios. Su marido se dedica a cultivar la tierra y ella es vendedora ambulante de artesanías, gracias al trabajo y sacrificio de ambos ya tienen su casa propia.

Entre las cosas que vende Eliodora, podemos citar cubrecamas artesanales hechos a mano y con hilos de algodón que también son hechos a manos por las artesanas de la ciudad. Todas las mañanas recorre los barrios casa por casa ofreciendo sus productos que son muy bien aceptados por sus clientes.

Además de esto, ella cría cerdos y los faena para venderlos, esto le genera un buen ingreso extra. Solicita el crédito para comprar cubrecamas de diferentes tamaños y colores en grandes cantidades.

loans.use: Purchase of bed covers of different types.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano is 52 years old and his wife, Blásida, is 45. They have six children: hree sons and three daughters. Two of their eldest children work in Argentina and the other four live with them and help them with their work and study.

Mariano’s principle activity is selling artisanal crafts like hammocks and quilts. His wife creates quilts from thread (quilt weaver). It has been more than 30 years since they have been involved in this work, and without knowing another trade, they moved forward giving their children education and sustenance.

Their area of work is the city of Posadas Argentina (a city that can be found in a few hours), where they have a customer base and continue to increase their business thanks to their efforts. Today, they work alongside one of their sons who also is becoming a successful entrepreneur thanks to the support of his parents.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Mariano tiene 52 años de edad y su esposa la señora Blásida 45, tienen seis hijos, tres varones y tres mujeres. Dos de sus hijos mayores se encuentran en Argentina trabajando, y los otros cuatro viven con ellos, les ayuda en el trabajo y estudian.

La actividad principal de don Mariano es la venta ambulante y a crédito de artículos artesanales como hamacas y colchas; y la de su esposa es fabricar colchas de hilo (tejedora de colchas). Hace más de treinta años que se dedican en este trabajo y sin conocer otro labor u oficio, ellos pudieron salir adelante dando alimento y educación a sus hijos.

Su zona de trabajo es la ciudad de Posadas Argentina (ciudad que se encuentra a unas pocas horas), en donde ya tiene clientela formada, y cada vez va aumentando su negocio gracias a su esfuerzo y empeño. Hoy día ya realiza esta actividad junto con uno de sus hijos que también ya va independizándose como un exitoso comerciante gracias al apoyo de sus padres.

loans.use: Purchase of hammocks and bed quilts.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.es:
Paulo is 52 years of age and his wife is 51. They have four children: two boys and two girls, who work at home helping take care of their cattle and, at the same time, studying.

Don Paulo is an ambulant seller of artisanal products like hammocks, quilts and table cloths. His wife is a seamstress of these products. As such, they are a team since she sews the quilts and hammocks and he sells them by going house-to-house.

Considering that sales are increasing, Paulo wishes to acquire a greater quantity of merchandise. In this manner, he will sell what his wife produces and also other crafts of the area. Paulo is soliciting a credit in order to purchase more quilts and hammocks.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Paulo tiene 52 años de edad y su esposa 51, tiene cuatro hijos, dos varones y dos mujeres, trabajan en la casa ayudando a cuidar de los ganados vacunos que tienen y a la vez estudian.

Don Paulo, se dedica a la venta ambulante y a crédito de artículos artesanales como hamacas, colchas y manteles; y su esposa es tejedora de estos productos; así entre ambos son un equipo ya que la señora teje las colchas y hamacas y Paulo las vende recorriendo casa por casa.

Considerando que las ventas aumentan cada vez más, Paulo desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías, de esta forma venderá lo que su esposa produce y también de otras artesanas de la zona. Para adquirir mas colchas y hamacas, es que Paulo solicita el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of quilts, hammocks and tablecloths.

loans.name: Reimunda

texts.es:
Mrs. S. is a 64-year-old widow with three grown up sons who are independent topographers.

Reimunda started her own fashion design business, but upon realizing that it was not profitable, she and her husband decided to make cotton and wool blankets to sell in nearby cities. Shortly after that, her husband passed away, and she was left with many debts and 3 children who were still very young.

Thanks to her enterprising spirit, she was able to push forth and endure the loss of her partner. Her business grow so much that she had to hire personnel so help her due to the high demand for her products. She then started to sell her merchandise to other retailers.

Today she is one of the biggest suppliers of these handicrafts to major retailers in the city. She is requesting this loan in order to buy bigger quantities of cotton and wool thread so that she may continue with her endeavors.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Reimunda tiene 64 años de edad, ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos todos varones, ya son profesionales (topógrafos) y trabajan en forma independiente.

Reimunda comenzó a trabajar en forma independiente como modista y al darse cuenta que no le era muy rentable, decidió fabricar junto con su marido colchas de hilo y lana empezando a tejer ella misma y su esposo las vendía en otras ciudades. Después al poco tiempo falleció su esposo, y ella se quedó con muchas deudas y sus tres niños que aún eran muy pequeños.

Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor logró salir adelante sobrellevando la falta de su compañero. Así fue creciendo hasta que tuvo que contratar a personales para que le hicieran el trabajo por el aumento de la demanda de sus productos y ella empezó a salir a vender los productos.

Hoy día ella es una de las mayores proveedoras de esta artesanía de las tiendas más grandes de la ciudad. Ella solicita el crédito para poder adquirir en grandes cantidades hilos de lana y algodón para seguir con su gran producción.

loans.use: Purchase of cotton and wool thread

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
Mrs. Rossana F. is 26 years of age, single, and lives with her parents. Her siblings are all married and work in Argentina.

She started knitting traditional bedspreads and hammocks with her mother when she was only 8 years old. She has been selling her merchandise in the capital city of Asunción for 5 years because it is quite lucrative to do so. Thanks to both her hard work and her savings, she was able to buy a motorcycle, which is her main means of transportation for selling her hammocks and bedspreads.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy merchandise such as hammocks, blankets, sashes, and bed sheets because her clients have ordered these products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra Rossana F., tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y es la única que vive con sus padres, ya que sus otros hermanos trabajan en Argentina y todos están casados.

Ella empezó desde los 8 años a tejer con su mamá la tradicional sobrecamas y hamacas que su mamá vendía por la zona. Desde hace 5 años ella vende sus mercaderías en la capital (ciudad de Asunción) ya que le resulta más rentable. Gracias a su trabajo y ahorro pudo comprar una motocicleta que es su principal movilidad para llevar y ofrecer sus hamacas y sobrecamas.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.

loans.use: Purchase of hammocks, bedspreads, sashes, and sheets

texts.es:
Sixto S. is 40 years old. He is a native of the Barrio Virgen de Fátima de Carapeguá. He is single and has his own home. His neighbors know him as an upright, hardworking person. He is a street vendor who sells handicrafts on weekends and works as a contractor during the week.

Mr. S. states that he recently endured a difficult experience. His mother suffered a heart attack and was hospitalized for a long period of time. Since Mr. S. is an only child, he suffered many hardships alone. His mother has since recuperated and he is happy because he was able to cover all medical expenses with the money he was able to save these past few years.

With this loan, he will buy more handmade bedspreads, which will increase his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Sixto S. tiene 40 años es oriundo del Barrio Virgen de Fátima de Carapeguá es soltero tiene casa propia es conocido por sus vecinos por ser una persona muy trabajadora y honrada , se dedica a la venta ambulante de artesanía los fines de semana y los demás días trabaja como contratista de obras.

Comentó el Señor Sixto que hace poco paso por una experiencia muy difícil, su madre había sufrido un infarto y estuvo hospitalizada por mucho tiempo y como el es hijo único paso por muchas necesidades solo. Hoy día su madre esta recuperada y el se siente feliz ya que con los ahorros que junto durante estos años pudo correr con los gastos del tratamiento.

Con el préstamo obtenido comprará más sobrecamas artesanales ya que la venta de estos productos le genera bastante ganancia

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Señora Ana is 33 years old and a single mother of three children ages 15, 12 and 9 respectively. She has an accounting practice and sells jewels, besides being a teacher of plastic arts in her spare time.

Through plastic arts she expresses her ideas and it is one of her passions. At present she works in her accounting practice and also sells jewels, since this generates her some extra income.

The loan that she has requested will be invested in the purchase of pure silver, chains, hoops, bracelets, etc.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Ana tiene 33 años es madre soltera de tres hijos de 15,12 y 9 respectivamente. Posee un estudio contable y es vendedora de joyas, además de ser profesora de artes plásticas en sus ratos libres.

Através de las artes plásticas expresa sus ideas y es una de sus pasiones, actualmente trabaja en su estudio contable pero además vende joyas ya que esto le genera un ingreso extra.

El préstamo que solicitado será invertido en la compra de plata pura, cadenas, aros, dijes, brazaletes, etc.

loans.use: To buy pure silver, chains, hoops, bracelets, etc.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Mrs. Dionicia M. is 42 years old and lives with Agustín Marecos and their 2 school age children. She and her partner run a small convenient store from their home in Asentamiento San Miguel in Yka'a in the city of Luque.

In 2006, she was the coordinator of a committee of women entrepreneurs, who benefited from group loans. After leaving the committee, she requested a personal loan, allowing her to invest in the expansion of her business and hence improve her income.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy more foodstuffs such as flour, rice, sugar, fruits, vegetables, milk, soft drinks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Dionicia M. tiene 42 años vive con Agustín Marecos y sus dos hijos, quienes aun están estudiando. Junto con su pareja, atienden una pequeña despensa en su casa, dentro del Asentamiento San Miguel de la compañía Yka'a de la ciudad de Luque.

Durante todo el año 2006 se desempeñó como coordinadora de un comité de mujeres emprendedoras, beneficiándose con varios créditos solidarios. Luego de retirarse del comité ella solicitó un crédito en forma individual, pudiendo con todos estos créditos invertir completamente en la ampliación de su negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar más mercaderías como gaseosas, harina, arroz, azúcar, frutas, vegetales, leche, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of more foodstuffs such as flour, rice, sugar, fruits, vegetables, milk, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
Sr. German is 31 years old and married to Sra. Carolina Candia, also 31 years old, who is a teacher. They have 2 daughters who are still in school.

German worked previously selling newspapers. His brother, who is a mechanic, taught him the skill of automobile repair. At present he has his own mechanic shop with a very good clientele.

In the future he would like their daughters to finish their studies and pursue a profession. Today he requests a loan to invest in the purchase of lubricants, oils and some replacement parts for vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. German tiene 31 años esta casado con la Sra. Carolina Candia de 31 años que es docente, poseen dos hijas que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.-

El señor anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de diarios, su hermano que es mecánico le llevó a trabajar con el enseñándole las técnicas de la automotriz. Actualmente posee un taller mecánico propio con muy buena clientela formada. -

En el futuro le gustaría que sus hijas culminen sus estudios y tengan una profesión. Hoy solicita el crédito para invertirlos en la compra de lubricantes, aceites y algunos repuestos para vehículos.

loans.use: purchase of oils, lubricants and some replacement parts for vehicles.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es:
Mrs. Gilda A. is a 46-year-old woman whose estranged husband lives in Spain. Five months ago, her daughter also left for Spain to join her father, who got her a job there.

Once on her own, she decided to set up a door to door apparel business with her savings. She has received several loans from Fundación Paraguaya to buy merchandise—such as cellular phones, blenders, hair dryers, apparel, etc.—for home solicitation sales.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of seasonal apparel such as T-shirts, shirts, skirts, pants, shorts, Capri pants, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Gilda tiene 46 años, está separada de su marido que reside en España. Su hija también viajó hace 5 meses aproximadamente junto al padre, quien le consiguió un trabajo.

Al quedarse sola ella decidió montar un negocio de venta de ropas a domicilio, juntando un poco de dinero. Ya ha recibido varios créditos de la Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de las mercaderías como ser celulares, licuadoras, secadores de pelo, ropas, etc. que vende a domicilio.

El crédito que solicita ahora es para invertirlo en la compra de ropas de temporada como remeras, camisas, faldas, pantalones, shorts, bermudas, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of apparel such as T-shirts, shirts, skirts, pants, shorts, Capri pants, etc.

loans.name: Adriana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Since Adriana was a little girl, she has worked with her mother, who made a living selling hamburgers and tostadas. After she got married, she decided to start a business like this to be able to make income in addition to that of her husband so she could have money for her children's expenses. Litlle by little, she has acquired clients who buy from her often.

However, the fight to grow her business continues, and this is why she is requesting a loan of $1125, which she is willing to pay back in 6 months. With this money, Adriana will be able to buy merchandise to supply her business and also to make some repairs like painting her business. With your help, Adriana will be able to keep her business growing so her kids can inherit it.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Adriana desde pequeña trabajaba con su mamá quien se dedicaba a la venta de hamburguesas y tostadas. Después de casarse decidió comenzar un negocio igual para poder obtener ingresos extras a los de su esposo y así poder tener dinero para los gastos de sus hijos. Poco a poco ha ido adquiriendo clientes que le compran frecuentemente.

Sin embargo la lucha por crecer sigue y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $1,125 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Con este dinero Adriana podrá comprar mercancía para surtir su negocio además de hacerle unos arreglos como pintar el negocio. Con tu ayuda Adriana podrá sacar adelante su negocio para que este les quede a sus hijos como un patrimonio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and expand her business

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto is a man who started working with his uncle and father in the taco-selling business when he was very young. This called his attention, and after his father died, he decided to become independent and start his own business to be able to make money to support his mother. Soon after he got married, he had to work more to be able to afford his family's expenses, and most importantly, the costs of his children's education.

Currently, Gilberto is requesting a credit to buy a structure to be able to grow his business. Right now he only has a taco cart, and it doesn't look very presentable. The credit that Gilberto is requesting is $575, to be repaid in 6 months. With this money, Gilberto will be able to buy merchandise to make his products as well as a structure to give a larger presence to his location. With your help, Gilberto will be able to take good care of his kids and to pay for their education so they can be good men.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Gilberto es un hombre que desde pequeño con la ayuda de un tío y su padre se ingresó en el negocio de la venta de tacos. Le llamó mucho la atención y después de que murió su padre el decidió independizarse y poner su propio negocio para poder sacar dinero para apoyar a su madre y poco después se casó, por lo tanto tuvo que trabajar más para poder sacar para los gastos de su familia y principalmente para los que tienen sus hijos de la escuela.

Actualmente Gilberto está solicitando un crédito para comprar una armazón para poder crecer su negocio. Puesto que actualmente solo tiene un carrito de tacos y ya no se encuentra muy presentable. El crédito que Gilberto solicita es de US $575 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Gilberto podrá comprar mercancía para poder hacer sus productos además de comprar una armazón para darle mayor presencia a su local. Con tu ayuda Gilberto podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos y pagarles sus estudios para que sean hombres de bien.

loans.use: To buy a structure for his taco cart

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio has two children who are 2 and 11 years old. He wishes to give them the best so they can have a future with better possibilities than he had. His grandfather began to work as a carpenter and taught this trade to his son and to Sergio. He passed along secrets and the best way to work with wood. Nevertheless, when his children began to grow, Sergio decided to become independent from his father so both of them could make more income.

However, the fight to grow has made him work at top speed. This is why Sergio is requesting a loan of $475 that he is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money, Sergio will be able to buy wood to make furniture to offer his clients. With your help, Sergio will be able to get ahead in his business, and his children will have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Sergio tiene hijos de los 2 a los 11 años, a los cuales desea darles lo mejor para que tengan un futuro con mayores posibilidades que el. Su abuelo fue quien comenzó a trabajar en el terreno de la carpintería enseñándole a su hijo y este a Sergio, pasándose los secretos y la mejor manera de aprovechar y rendir la madera. Sin embargo cuando sus hijos comenzaron a crecer Sergio decidió independizarse de su padre para así obtener más ingresos entre los dos.

Sin embargo la lucha por crecer lo ha ido llevando a trabajar a marchas forzadas. Es por es oque Sergio está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Y con este dinero Sergio podrá comprar madera para poder elaborar muebles para tener qué ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Sergio saldrá adelante en su negocio y sus hijos tendrán un mejor futuro.

loans.use: To purchase wood to make his products

texts.es:
Martina started to acquire experience at a job where she made dishes to sell at events. This is where she realized that in this business, she made good profits without spending so much time that she wasn't able to take care of her kids. Martina began to become independent by acquiring outside business. Little by little, through the good reference of her delicious food, she began making a name for herself among people who asked for her dishes more and more.

Nevertheless, during this season, she has various orders that she hasn't been able to start because she doesn't have enough money to buy the raw material. This is why she is requesting a loan of $375 that she is willing to pay back in 6 months. With this money, Martina will be able to sell her dishes to her clients that don't want to make New Year's Eve dinner themselves. With your help, Martina will be able to succeed and improve her busines.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Martina comenzó a adquirir experiencia en un trabajo en dónde hacía guisos para vender a eventos. Fue ahí donde se dio cuenta que este negocio dejaba buenas ganancias además de no quitarle tanto tiempo diario y así no descuidar a sus hijos. Martina comenzó a independizarse al adquirir negocios por fuera, y así poco a poco y con la buena referencia de lo rico de sus guiso se está haciendo camino ente la gente que poco a poco le piden más y más guisados.

Sin embargo para esta temporada tiene varios pedidos que no a podido comenzar puesto que no cuenta con dinero suficiente como para comprar la materia prima es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Martina podrá vender sus comidas a los clientes que no desean elaborar la cena de año nuevo. Con tu ayuda Martina podrá salir adelante y sacar adelante su negocio.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana C. is the head of her family. She takes care of her children, and learned how to get ahead by herself through selling food. Everything started four months ago when she decided to start a business because her neighbors were asking her for her food. They liked it so much that she adapted a space in her house to make it a small restaurant.

Nevertheless, she doesn't have enough supplies right now to keep making her dishes, besides offering her clients food for the holidays. This is why Juana is requesting a loan of $300, to be repaid in 4 months, to be able to buy merchandise to make her dishes. With your help, Juana will be able to keep her business going and to establish it so she can pass it on to her kids.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Juana C. es una jefa de familia, que tiene a su cargo sus hijos y sola a sabido salir adelante con la venta de comidas. Todo comenzó hace un año cuatro meses que se decidió a poner su negocio porque sus vecinos le pedían guisados y les gustaba mucho fue así que adecuó un espacio en su casa para poder hacerlo un restaurante pequeño.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con el suficiente material como para seguir elaborando comidas, además de ofrecerle a sus clientes comidas para las celebraciones. Es por es oque Juana está solicitando un crédito de US $300 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y así poder comprar mercancía para elaborar los guisados. Con tu ayuda Juana podrá salir adelante en su negocio y estabilizarlo para poder tenerlo como un patrimonio.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make her foods

loans.name: Eli

texts.es:
Three months ago, Eli worked with a gentleman who made ice cream to sell, and this is how he learned the tricks of making good ice cream. This is where he realized that he could sell these products and make good profits. Little by little, with ups and downs, Eli made clients who came to him because of the delicious flavor that he gives to his ice cream.

However, in this season, his profits are scarce, his expenses are higher, and he is losing the money he had to buy merchandise. This is why he is requesting a loan of $300, which he will repay in 4 months. With this money, he will be able to buy merchandise to make his ice cream and not lose the clientele he has. In spite of the lower temperatures, many of his clients still look for his ice cream to eat. With your help, Eli will be able to succeed in this season and enter the warmer weather with more enthusiasm.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hace más de trece años que Eli trabajaba con un señor que hacía nieves para vender fue como aprendió los trucos para elaborar unas buenas nieves. Fue ahí donde se dio cuenta que él podía vender estos productos y obtener mayores ganancias. Poco a poco y con altas y bajas Eli se ha ido haciendo de clientes que lo buscan por el rico sabor que les pone.

Sin embargo en esta temporada las ganancias son muy escasas, y los gastos se vuelven mayores y el dinero ahorrado para la mercancía se pierde. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y así con este dinero poder comprar mercancía para elaborar sus nieves y no perder la clientela con la que ya cuenta. Y es que a pesar de que las temperaturas bajan muchos de sus clientes siguen buscando nieves para comer. Con tu ayuda Eli podrá salir adelante en esta temporada y entrar con más ganas a los inicios de calor.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to make ice cream

texts.es:
Unfortunately, Irene's mother suffered an embolism and can no longer manage by herself. The money her husband earns isn't enough to pay for all of the family's expenses and Irene's mother's medications. This is why Irene decided to start a business that didn't take up a lot of her time to be able to take care of her mother. She started to buy shoes to resell among her friends and neighbors.

However, she doesn't have enough supplies of winter shoes right now to be able to offer her clients. This is why she is requesting a loan of $300 that she is willing to repay in 4 months. With this money, Irene will be able to buy shoes to have a better assortment. With your help, Irene will be able to make enough money to pay for her mother's medications.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Lamentablemente la madre de Irene sufrió una Embolia y ya no puede valerse por sí sola. Y lo que gana el esposo de Irene no alcanza para los gastos de la familia y las medicinas de la mamá de Irene. Es por eso que Irene decidió comenzar un negocio que no le quite mucho tiempo y le deje ganancias para poder atender a su mamá. Es por eso que comenzó a comprar zapatos para revenderlo entre sus amigos y vecinos.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con mucho surtido de invierno como para ofrecerle a sus clientes es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero Irene podrá comprar más zapatos para tener un mejor surtido. Con tu ayuda Irene podrá sacar dinero para poder pagar las medicinas de su mamá.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro A. has 2 children, and he wishes to give them the best and to be able to offer them the opportunity to go to college so they can have a better life than they have had up to now. After having worked for a long time at a company where they laid him off due to a personnel reduction, he used his severance pay to invest in a location and supplies to make tacos. With his wife's help, he started to perfect his tacos, and his clients kept coming back to buy them.

Right now, Alejandro thinks it is a good time to grow his business and make improvements so his clients feel more comfortable eating at his restaurant. This is why Alejandro is requesting a credit of $1,125 that he's is willing to pay back in 6 months. With this money, he will be able to buy merchandise to offer new products and make improvements to his business. With your help, Alejandro will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Alejandro A. tiene 2 hijos a los cuales desea darles siempre lo mejor y poder ofrecerles la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera para que en su vida les vaya mejor que como les ha ido hasta hoy. Después de haber trabajado mucho tiempo en una empresa los despidieron por recorte de personal y fue así que con el finiquito (dinero que dan cuando despiden al trabajador) invierte en un local y material para poder elaborar tacos. Con la ayuda de su esposa fue como comenzó a darle sazón a sus tacos y así los clientes regresaban a comprarles.

Sin embargo Alejandro considera que hoy es un buen momento para poder crecer su negocio haciéndole adecuaciones para que sus clientes se sientan más cómodos en comer en su local. Es por eso que Alejandro está solicitando un crédito de US $1125 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y así con este dinero poder comprar mercancía para ofrecer nuevos productos y hacerle mejoras al local. Con tu ayuda Alejandro podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: To expand his business and purchase raw material

texts.vi:
Ms Hoa is 23, she is married and has 1 daughter. Everyday she goes to the market near her house to sell vegetables and fruits. She also raises pigs at home. Her husband is a cabinet maker. Ms Hoa has never applied for a loan before. When she learned that BinhMinh fund (SEDA) opened a branch in her town, she had applied for a loan because the conditions are easy to meet. She would use the loan to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva vonlunteer.

Chị Hoa 23 tuổi, chi đã có 1 con gái. Hàng ngày, chị đi chợ bán hoa quả tại chợgần nhà. Ngoài ra chị con chăn nuôi tại nhà một đàn lợn thịt. Chồng chị làm nghề mộc chuyên đóng hàng nội thất. Chị chưa tham gia vay vốn ở đâu. Khi biết đến chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh về đến tận nơi chị sinh sống và hình thức cho vay rất tiện lợi và phù hợp, chị đã tham gia ngay để có thêm vốn hỗ trợ cho việc kinh doanh của chị.

texts.es:
Seventeen years ago, Bertha Lidia started to sell clay items out of her house, but an opportunity came to her to obtain a small location very close to the main bus station in her city. This is why she changed locations and started to sell items like backpacks, toys, and other things. Little by little, she started to gain clients who came by her business to buy crafts and clay items.

However, during this season when many people travel to celebrate the holidays, Bertha doesn't have enough assortment to sell new merchandise. This is why she is requesting a credit of $325 that she is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money, Bertha will be able to purchase merchandise to have something to offer her clients. With your help, Bertha will be able to take good care of her 4 kids.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hace 17 años que Bertha Lidia comenzó a vender artículos de barro fuera de su casa, sin embargo le llegó la oportunidad de conseguir un pequeño local muy cerca de la central de autobuses en su localidad. Es por es que se cambió de local y comenzó a meter artículos como mochilas, juguetes, entre otras cosas. Y poco a poco se está haciendo de clientes que pasan por su negocio y le compran artesanías y productos de barro.

Sin embargo para esta temporada en que muchos salen de viaje para festejar las fechas Bertha no cuenta con surtido suficiente para poder vender mercancía nueva. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Bertha podrá comprar mercancía para tener algo que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Bertha podrá sacar adelante a sus cuatro hijos.

Fernando is a young man who has learned how to get ahead in spite of everything he has had to overcome. Some time ago, his father got terribly ill, and Fernando had to take charge of his business. This is where Fernando saw that the best way of making money was to be his own boss for himself and his family.

However, he doesn't have enough merchandise to offer his clients right now. This is why Fernando is requesting a loan of $375 that he is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money, he will be able to buy merchandise to be able to have something to offer his clients. With your help, Fernando will be able to get ahead and to support his family so they don't lack anything.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Fernando es un joven que a sabido salir adelante, a pesar de todo lo que a tenido que superar puesto que hace tiempo que su padre se enfermó terriblemente teniendose que ponerse a cargo del negocio Fernando, y ahí fue donde vio que la mejor manera de obtener dinero era siendo su propio dueño para él y para su familia.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que Fernando está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Fernando podrá comprar mercancía para poder tener algo que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Fernando podrá salir adelante para poder apoyar a su familia y que no les falte nada.

When María Eugenia got married, her husband covered all of their home's expenses. When she started to have their children, the money he made didn't go as far. The moment came when they didn't have enough to pay for their children's education. Eugenia didn't want her kids not to have an education, so she started to buy and resell clothing and shoes among her family members and friends. With the little money she made, she restocked her business.

Right now, they want to grow their business more to make more profits since what they are earning still doesn't cover their expenses. This is why Eugenia is requesting a credit of $850 that she is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money, she will buy more merchandise to be able to make more income so her children can study and be honorable people with more opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

María Eugenia se casó y todos los gastos del hogar los cubría su esposo, sin embargo cuando comenzaron a nacer sus hijos fue cuando el dinero comenzó a rendirles menos. Y llegó un momento en que no les alcanzaba para pagar los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos. Pero Eugenia no quiere que sus hijos no tengan educación y por eso que comenzó a comprar y revender ropa y zapatos entre sus familiares y amigos, con lo poco que juntaba resurtía su negocio.

Sin embargo actualmente desean crecer más su negocio para poder obtener más ganancias puesto que lo que están ganando los dos ya no les alcanza para poder pagar los gastos. Es por eso que Eugenia está solicitando un crédito de US $850 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero comprar más mercancía para poder así sacar más ingresos para que sus hijos estudien y sena unas personas de bien con más oportunidades.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús has three children who he is very proud of since they are fighting to get ahead. With the faith that his children would go to college to get ahead, he started to sell hamburgers out of his house to be able to make enough money to pay for their schooling. This is why he started this business 4 years ago.

Right now, the utensils that he has are very damaged, and some don't work. This is why he is requesting a loan of $475, to be repaid in 6 months. With this money, he will be able to buy utensils for the kitchen and raw materials to make his hamburgers. With your help, Jesús will be able to feel proud that through much effort, his kids went to college and are honorable people.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Jesús tiene tres hijos de quienes se siente muy orgulloso puesto que están luchando por salir adelante. Sin embargo don José con la fe en que si sus hijos estudian una carrera universitaria van a salir adelante, comenzó a vender hamburguesas fuera de su casa para poder sacar dinero para pagarles los gastos de la escuela a sus hijos. Es por esto que hace 4 años que comenzó con este negocio.

Sin embargo actualmente los utensilios con los que cuenta ya están muy dañados y otros no sirven es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para poder pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Jesús podrá comprar utensilios para la cocina y materia prima para elaborar sus hamburguesas. Con tu ayuda Jesús podrá sentirse orgulloso que con mucho esfuerzo sus tres hijos estudiaron la universidad y son personas de bien.

loans.use: To buy utensils to make hamburgers

loans.name: Ivan Rafael

texts.es:
Iván has a beautiful family. He hopes to give his wife and two small children the best so they don't lack anything and can have the possiblity of offering a better future to their children. Since they have reunions at their house, Iván realized that he has a lot of talent for roasting meat and preparing delicious sauces and tacos. This is why he stopped working to start his own business with the goal of making a larger income. Little by little, through much effort, he has made clients who come to him in the evenings to buy his tacos.

Iván thinks that this is an opportune moment to grow his business and to offer his clients better service. This is why he is requesting a loan of $300 that he is willing to repay in 4 months. With this money, Iván will be able to buy raw materials to make his products and supplies to offer his clients better service. With your help, Iván will be able to take good care of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Iván tiene una hermosa familia; su esposa y dos pequeños hijos a quienes Iván desea darles lo mejor para que a ellos no les falte nada y puedan tener posibilidades de brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Desde que hacían reuniones en su casa, Iván se dio cuenta que tenía mucha habilidad para asar la carne y para elaborar salsas y tacos muy sabrosos. Fue así que dejó de trabajar para emprender su propio negocio con la finalidad de obtener un mejor ingreso. Poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo ha ido haciéndose de clientes que lo buscan por las noches para poder comprarle tacos.

Sin embargo Iván considera que es momento oportuno para crecer su negocio y poder ofrecerles un mejor servicio. Es por esto que Iván está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero Iván podrá comprar materia prima para sus productos e insumos para poder ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Iván podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To repair his location and buy merchandise

loans.name: Thi Ngai

texts.vi:
