They will use their savings to finish the second story of their house, to run their businesses, to buy land and for the education of their children.

Elvira, Rose and Rosalinda’s dreams incluD. buying a computer, working on their house, growing their businesses, opening a store of costume jewelry, distributing wholesale, educating their children to be professionals and beginning a new wood sale business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvira, Rosa y Rosalinda son socias del Banco Comunal Paraíso desD. hace 11, 3, 1 año respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal dicen que aprendieron a ser más organizadas, a ser generosas, responsables, puntuales y a ahorrar.

Elvira tiene 53 años y 2 hijos, Elvira presta servicios D. digitación, elabora distintos documentos y lo realiza en una calle céntrica D. Ayacucho, actividad que realiza hace 20años.

Por otro lado Rosa tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Rosa hace 3 años venD. ropa a pedido. Su mercadería lo trae D. Lima y a veces D. Tacna y anteriormente ella tenía una tienda D. abarrotes y lo cerró porque ya no tenía venta.

Mientras que Rosalinda tiene 24 años y 1 hijo y en su negocio realiza lindos trabajos D. bisutería, como joyas, aretes, anillos, actividad que aprendió en Lima cuando trabajaba con sus primas, además D. la bisutería ella venD. ropa a pedido.

Elvira, Rosa y Rosalinda necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 800 soles y 600 soles, que serán invertidos en la compra D. papeles, mostacillas, mostacillones, asas, aros, piedras importadas, polos, jeans, polos, chompas, blusas. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para terminar el segundo piso D. su casa, implementar su negocio, comprar un terreno y para la educación D. sus hijos.

Los sueños D. Elvira, Rosa y Rosalinda son comprar una computadora y trabajar en su casa, tener un negocio mas granD., una tienda D. bisutería y repartir por mayor, sus hijos sean profesionales e implementar un nuevo negocio D. venta D. maderas.

loans.use: To purchase papers, beads of various sizes, handles, hoops, imported stones, polos, jeans, sweaters, and blouses.

texts.en: Tahir A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Mr. A. is 56 years old, married and has two children. He is engaged in cattle-breding. Tahir has ten years experience at this business. He is requesting a loan of $700, with which he plans to buy an additional male calf and increase the number of the cow he owns.

Gulaya S. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 45 years old, married and has three children. She is selling women clothes in Beylagan city bazaar. She has seven years experience at this business. Gulaya has borrowed three loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch and repaid these loans timely. Now Gulaya needs a loan in amount of $600 to buy more kind of clothes and expand her business.

Emin M. lives in Beylagan, a small city in the southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 35 years old, married, and has two children. He sells men's shoes in Beylagan city bazaar. He has been working in this business sector since 1997. He has obtained three loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch. These loans were very successful for his business and because of this he again applied to Normicro. Now he wants to borrow a loan in the amount of $1000, this time he plans to buy more kinds of shoes.

Sariah is 44-year-old woman who produces bamboo handicrafts at her house. She usually earns about US$ 23 per month. Her husband, M., has no fixed income. She is requesting a loan of US$ 150 to expand her business. Since she became a member of MBK, her business is doing better and better. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.name: Paul

texts.fr:
Born in 1982 in Djakotomé, Benin, Mr Paul N. currently lives in Amégnran, Togo where he is a motocycle mechanic. He is married and the father of two (2) children. To build his business, he requests a loan of $200 to buy himself tools and replacement parts in order to have sufficient stock to satisfy his clientele. Mr N. is recognized in the area for his fine service and fair business ethics.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1982 à Djakotomé (RB), Monsieur N. Paul vit actuellement à Amégnran où il est mécanicien à 2 roues. Il est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Pour renforcer son activité, il sollicite un financement de $200 pour s’acheter des matériels de travail et des pièces de rechanges afin de pouvoir disposer d’un stock acceptable et satisfaire sa clientèle. Monsieur N. est reconnu dans le milieu de par ses prestations de service et jouit d’une bonne moralité.

loans.use: To buy tools and replacement parts

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Born in 1967, Mr Kossi A. is married and the father of four (4) children. A planter in the aforementioned town, he markets products derived from palm tree oil. His plantation of palm trees is aging and he is today in the process of selling a large portion to be cut down. Therefore, he feels a need to renew the plantation. He requests a loan of $500 to prepare the land and buy young palm tree plants. The completion of this project will allow him to secure his income so that he can provide the necessities for his family.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1967, Monsieur A. Kossi est marié et père de quatre (4) enfants. Planteur dans ledit village, il commercialise les produits dérivés du palmier à huile. Sa plantation de palmiers est vieillissante et il est aujourd’hui en train de vendre une grande partie pour l’abattage. Ainsi, le besoin de renouvellement se fait sentir. Pour aménager le terrain et acheter de jeunes plants de palmiers, il sollicite un crédit de $500. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra de sécuriser son revenu afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy young palm tree plants

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjo K. is the mother of 2 children and comes from a poor family. Her husband’s income does not cover all the household expenses. She sells maize gruel in the morning and fried yams in the early afternoon. She requests a loan of $200 to be able to buy the yams and bags of maize wholesale in order to grow her business.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Adjo K. est mère de 2 enfants et issue d’une famille pauvre. Les revenus de son mari n’arrivent pas à couvrir toutes les charges du foyer. Revendeuse de bouillie le matin et d’igname frite au bord l’après midi. Elle sollicite un montant de $200 pour pouvoir acheter en gros les ignames et les sacs de maïs afin d’agrandir la taille de son commerce.

loans.use: To buy yams and bags of maize wholesale

loans.name: Tévi Komi

texts.fr:
Mr Tévi Komi K. was born in 1964 in Amegnran, Togo. He is married and the father of five children. He has run his furniture shop for 17 years now. In addition to his main line of business, he practices farming, which allows for him to better afford the cost of living because he buys less produce.

Well known in the area for his services, he has an important clientele. To secure his income, he wants to add the sale of the boards to his business. It is important also to note that he is a carpenter. He knows very well the twists and turns of this line of work. He requests a loan of $1000 for this project. This will allow for him to increase his income and to improve the conditions of his life.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Tévi Komi est né en 1964 à Amégnran (P/Vo). Marié et père de cinq enfants, il exerce la menuiserie depuis maintenant 17 ans. En dehors de son activité principale, il pratique l’agriculture ; ce qui lui permet d’amortir le coût de vie parce qu’il achète moins les produits vivriers. Très reconnu dans le milieu de par ses prestations, il a une clientèle importante. Pour sécuriser son revenu, il veut associer à son activité la vente des planches. Il faut aussi souligner qu’étant menuisier, il connaît très bien les contours de ce commerce. Il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour réaliser ce projet. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître son revenu et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy boards in order to make furniture.

texts.en: Komariah is 42-year-old woman who has been producing bamboo mats at her house ever since she joined MBK. Before that, her husband, S., was the only one who worked in the family. Now, she can earn US$ 20 per month from her own business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 150 to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.name: Morenita Hga Group

texts.es:
"Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga" got started 2 years ago. Today there are 26 members who have been together for 8 cycles. Their founders were Hilda, Luisa, Isabel and Victoria.

The members say: "in our bank we have a great time and we learn a lot through conferences". They also say they have learned a lot about values, diseases and the importance of saving money.

Members do a wiD. variete of jobs such as selling chickens, natural products, food, canned goods, cheeses and dairy products. They also offer taxi services, custom maD. jewelry, local clothing, jewelry and other services.

Each member has a story, such as the case of Rosalia who got her small business started with just two pieces of furniture. She currently has a multiservice store where she offers lots of services and has lots of customers.

Olga and her husband have a workshop where they make custom maD. jewelry. At the beginning they only had two machines and slowly but surely began to increase; they currently supply uniforms to various institution. Very soon they will be opening a store in which they will be selling fabrics.

The members need different amounts of loans for many different reasons. Some need 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, etc. The grand total of their loan is 12200 soles through Banco Comunal.

The loan will be used to purchase milk, bread, chocolates, toys, wool, threads, firewood, and gold for the opening of a new store. They will also change the furniture in their new store and to repair their taxicab. The savings will be used to gain their own capital, purchase land, build their own house and proviD. an education to their children.

Their dream is to have a minimarket, have their own home, own business, a restaurant chain and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga se inició hace 2 años. Actualmente son 26 socias y ya tienen 8 ciclos juntas. Las socias fundadoras fueron Hilda, Luisa, Isabel, Victoria. Las socias mencionan “en nuestro Banco Comunal la pasamos bonito y aprendemos mucho en las charlas”, y dicen que han aprendido acerca D. los valores, D. las enfermedades y a ahorrar. Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. pollo, productos naturales, comida, abarrotes, quesos y lácteos, también brindan servicios D. taxi, confección D. prendas D. vestir D. alta costura, artesanía en telar, joyería y Multiservicios. Cada socia tiene una historia que contar, como es el caso D. Rosalía, quien inició su negocio con una tienda pequeña con tan solo 2 muebles, y actualmente tiene un Multiservicios donD. ofrece productos variados y tiene muchos clientes. Por otro lado Olga y su esposo tienen un taller D. confección D. prendas D. vestir. Al inicio ellos solo tenían 2 máquinas y poco a poco fueron creciendo y, actualmente, elaboran uniformes para diferentes instituciones. Próximamente implementarán una tienda para la venta D. telas. Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 12200 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. leche, panetón, chocolates, juguetes, lanas, hilos, leña, oro, para la implementación D. una nueva tienda D. telas, cambio D. muebles D. su restaurante y para la reparación D. su taxi. Los ahorros los utilizarán para tener un capital propio, comprar un terreno, construcción D. C. y para la educación D. sus hijos. Los sueños D. las socias son tener un minimarket, tener C. propia, negocio propio, una cadena D. restaurante y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase milk, bread, chocolates, toys, wool, threads, firewood, and gold for the opening of a new store. They will also change the furniture in their new store and to repair their taxicab.

texts.en: Amih is 44-year-old woman who makes a living by producing bamboo mats at her house and usually earns about US$ 22.50 per month. Her husband, M., has no fixed income, so the family really depends on her income. Now she needs a loan of US$ 150 to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akou B. was born in 1985. Her husband drives a taxi bike and his income does not allow for him to pay all the household expenses. Thanks to the income of her cake business, Madam B. is able to contribute to the household costs. She requests a loan of $500 to buy bags of wheat flour, sugar and other ingredients for the production of her cakes.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Akou B. est née en 1985. Son mari est un chauffeur de taxi-moto et son revenu ne lui permet pas à supporter toutes les charges de la maison. Grâce aux revenus de son commerce de gâteaux, Madame B. arrive à contribuer aux charges du ménage. Elle sollicite un financement de $500 pour acheter des sacs de farine de blé, du sucre et autres intrants pour la production de son gâteau.

loans.use: To buy bags of wheat flour, sugar and other ingredients to make cakes

loans.name: Ahoéfa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ahoéfa A. was born in 1953 and is a widow and mother of five children. She sells basic food items and especially fried fish. She purchases fish to fry and sell by the piece to customers. Since she does not have much in the way of financial means, she is asking for a loan of US$ 800 which will allow her to procure more fish on a regular basis to better satisfy her customers' needs and increase her income from her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1953, Madame A. Ahoéfa est veuve et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Revendeuse de denrées alimentaires et surtout de poissons frits pour la cuisine. Elle se procure de poissons, les fait frire et les revend en détail aux consommateurs. Manque de moyens financiers, elle sollicite un financement de $800 qui va lui servir d’augmenter l’approvisionnement en poissons pour mieux satisfaire son environnement et aussi accroître le rendement de ses activités afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use:
purchase and re-sale of basic food items

achat et vente de denrées alimentaires

loans.name: Leoncia Maria's Group

texts.es:
Leoncia, Nieves and Sonia belong to Banco Comunal Qory Qaytu whose meaning is "Golden Thread" in the dialect of quechua. They have belonged to this bank for 1 year, 4 years and 1 year each respectively.

They tell us that through this bank they learned to be united, responsible, and punctual. They say: "here we feel happy, we forget about our problems for a while". They also mention that the loan the get from the bank is of great help.

Leonicia sells vegetables, meats and canned goods in the jungles of Ayacucho and at the local markets. She also brings fruits back with her from different zones to sell them at the Nery Garcia Market.

Nieves has been selling firewood for 4 years and she does this from her home. She commented that she became a member of the bank thanks to a friend.

Although Sonia and her husband have an iron shop, she has been selling firewood from her home since last year.

Leonicia, Nieves, and Sonia need a loan of 900 soles, 1000 soles and 1000 soles respectively which will be used to purchase fice, noodles, sugar, wheat, chicken, carrots, firewood, charcoal, paints, wrough iron supplies and big metal sheets.

Their savings will be used for their children's education, some emergencies they might have, and their own capital. These women's dreams are to make sure their kids move forward in life, give them a good education, improve their home and perhaps be able to open another business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Leoncia, Nieves y Sonia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Qory Qaytu que significa “Hilo de Oro” en quechua, desde hace 1, 4, 1 años respectivamente. Ellas cuentan que en el Banco Comunal ellas aprendieron a ser unidas, responsables, puntuales; dice “aquí nos sentimos alegres, olvidamos por un momento nuestros problemas”. También mencionan que el préstamo que les da el Banco Comunal es de gran ayuda para sus negocios. Leoncia vende verduras, carne y abarrotes en la Selva de Ayacucho, es feriante y vende en el Mercado de Pichari y de las ferias trae frutas de la zona para luego venderlos en el mercado Nery García. Por otro lado Nieves vende leña desde hace 4 años y lo hace en su casa. Ella cuenta que llegó a ser socia del Banco Comunal por invitación de una amiga. Mientras que Sonia junto a su esposo tienen un taller de planchado y pintura, Sonia además vende leña desde hace 1 año en su casa. Leoncia, Nieves y Sonia necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 1000 soles, 1000 soles respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra de arroz, fideo, azúcar, trigo, pollo, zanahoria, leña, carburo, pinturas, soldaduras, planchas metálicas. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para los estudios de sus hijos, alguna emergencia, tener un capital propio. Los sueños de Leoncia, Nieves y Sonia son sacar adelante a sus hijos, darles una buena educación, mejorar su casa y tener otro negocio.

loans.use: Leoncia, Nieves and  Sonia need a loan to purchase  rice, wheat, chickens, carrots, firewood, charcoal, paints, wrough iron sheets

loans.name: Adjo Rose

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjo Rose E., 33, was born in Lomé and is responsible for the livelihood of three children. She is a seamstress and has a workshop and apprentices but does not have sufficient capital to purchase new sewing machines so that she can pass on her skills in sewing to the younger generation and also satisfy the demands of her clientele while allowing her apprentices to earn a living wage.

To make her business more profitable, she is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 so that she can purchase some new machines. Her goal is to improve working conditions in her workshop and at the same time serve her clientele, for everyone's social and economic well-being.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 33 ans, Madame E. Adjo Rose est née à Lomé et a à sa charge trois (3) enfants. Couturière, elle dispose d’un atelier et des apprenties et manque suffisamment de moyens pour l’achat de nouvelles machines afin de promouvoir sa connaissance en la matière et aussi de mieux satisfaire ses clients et mettre en état confortable ses apprenties.

Pour rendre son activité prestigieuse, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter de nouvelles machines afin d’améliorer les conditions de travail très favorable pour son atelier afin de servir la clientèle pour le mieux être économique et social.

loans.use:
purchase of new sewing machines

achat de machines à coudre

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr:
Mrs. Béatrice N., 26, was born in Dapaong and lives in the Hédzranawoé district of Lomé with her husband. Her business activity is door-to-door (ambulant) sales of tooth picks and she is the mother of three children. Her husband is a cook who is going through a difficult patch right now, since he has been unable to find steady work. It is Mrs. N.'s little ambulant sales business that provides the income for the most urgent needs of the family. She is therefore asking for a loan of US$ 800 so that she can buy her products in bulk and thus assure a constant supply for re-sale. By retailing products that she has purchased at wholesale prices, she manages to earn enough of a profit margin to keep her family going.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 26 ans, Madame Béatrice N. est née à Dapaong et réside au quartier Hédzranawoé à Lomé avec son mari. Revendeuse de cuir dent et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle s’est mariée à un cuisinier qui actuellement s’en sort difficilement car il n’arrive pas à trouver un emploi stable. Et c’est grâce à son petit commerce de cuir dent que madame arrive à subvenir à quelques besoins urgents de la famille. Elle voulait à cet effet avoir un crédit de $800 pour acheter en gros et faire un stock consistant. En les revendant en détaillant elle peut réaliser d’important bénéfice pour pouvoir satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
Distribution of tooth picks

Ravitaillement en cuir dent

loans.name: Leonilda Valladolid Gonzales' Group

texts.es:
Leonilda is 26 and has two children. Celia is 24 and has one child, while Eulogio is 63 and has four children. Leonilda, Celia and Eulogio belong to the Banco Comunal Qory Qaytu which means “Golden Thread” in quechua. Leonilda has sold fish for five years in the Chorro market in the city of Ayacucho, which she learned from her sisters-in-law. Celia has owned a small grocery store for five years. When she started, she had few products but now her business has grown. Meanwhile Eulogio, along with his wife, has run a small grocery store in his house for twenty years. They need loans of 600 soles, 900 soles and 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of seafood, white fish, mussels, sugar, rice, gas, milk, bread, noodles and wine. Leonilda, Celia and Eulogio tell us that through the Banco Comunal, they have learned to save, to be responsible, and to attend their meetings on time. They will use their savings to buy land, increase the capital for their businesses and on home expenses. Their dreams are that their children have better lives and educations and to have family unity.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Leonilda tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Celia tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, mientras que Eulogio tiene 63 años y 4 hijos. Leonilda, Celia y Eulogio pertenecen al Banco Comunal Qory Qaytu que significa “Hilo de Oro”en quechua. Leonilda vende pescado desde hace 5 años, en el mercado Chorro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que aprendió de sus cuñadas. Por otro lado Celia tiene una tienda de abarrotes hace 5 años y, en un inició tenía muy pocos productos pero actualmente su negocio ha crecido. Mientras que Eulogio junto a su esposa tienen una tienda de abarrotes en su casa desde hace 20 años. Ellos necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 900 soles y 600 soles, que serán invertidos en la compra de mariscos, pescado blanco, choros, azúcar, arroz, gaseosas, leche, panetones, fideos, vinos. Leonilda, Celia y Eulogia cuenta que en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, a ser responsables y a asistir puntualmente a sus reuniones. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para comprar un terreno, aumentar más capital a su negocio y para los gastos del hogar. Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una mejor vida, que haya unión familiar, sus hijos tengan una mejor educación.

loans.use: They need loans of 600 soles, 900 soles and 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of seafood, white fish, mussels, sugar, rice, gas, milk, bread, noodles and wine.

loans.name: Marina's Group

texts.es:
Clementina, Marina, and Cleofé have been partners of “Banco Comunal Muyurina” (Communal Bank Muyurina) for 4, 1, and 4 years respectively.

Doña Clementina is 54 years old and has 8 children. She sells vegetables at the market “Nery García”, but she also grows different crops on her land, such as Chinese onion, cilantro, and spinach, among others.

Marina is 30 years old and has 3 children. She owns a beauty parlor and sells cosmetics and jewelry.

Cleofé is 35 years old and has 4 children. She is a farmer and grows different vegetables depending on the season and the demands. Her products are sold at the market “Nery García”.

Clementina, Marina, and Cleofé request loans of 1000 soles, 1000 soles, and 600 soles ($900.00) which will be invested in buying vegetable seeds, fertilizer, incecticides, shampoo, earrings, hairpins, perfumes, and colognes.

The savings will be used to purchase more land, for the education of their children, and to increase their business capital.

The dream of Clementina, Marina, and Cleofé is to build their house, improve business, buy a vehicle, and proviD. better education for their children so they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Stlruck, Kiva volunteer.

Clementita, Marina y Cleofé son socias del Banco Comunal Muyurina hace 4, 1, 4 años respectivamente. Clementina tiene 54 años y 8 hijos, y venD. verduras en el mercado Nery García, pero además D. vender verduras, también siembra en sus chacras diferentes verduras como cebolla china, culantro, espinaca, entre otros. Marina tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Marina tiene un salón D. belleza y venD. cosméticos y joyas. Cleofé tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, es agricultora, siembra diferentes verduras dependiendo la época y la demanda. Las ventas D. sus productos son realizadas en el mercado Nery García. Clementita, Marina y Cleofé necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 1000 soles y 600 soles, que serán invertidos en la compra D. semillas D. verduras, abono, insecticidas, champú, aretes, ganchos, perfumes, colonias. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para comprar más chacras, para la educación D. sus hijos, aumentar el capital D. su negocio. Los sueños D. Clementita, Marina y Cleofe son construir su casa, mejorar su negocio, comprar un carro, mejor educación para sus hijos y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, shampoo, earrings, hairpins, perfumes, and colognes.

loans.name: Menelio

texts.es:
Don Menelio is 24 years old, married to doña Nelly Fleitas who is also a merchant, and they have a two-year old son.

Mr. Menelio is a vendor, he owns a motorcycle for distribution and debt collection of the merchandise he sells. Previously he worked as an employee with a private enterprise. His father, who is also a vendor, supported him to become independent and presently don Menelio has more than three-hundred clients in several parts of the country.

The requested loan will be invested in buying jeans, t-shirts, sports footwear, slippers, sheets, bedspreads, tablecloths, stockings, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Menelio tiene 24 años esta casado con la Sra. Nelly Fleitas que también es comerciante, tienen un hijo pequeño de dos años de edad.

El señor es vendedor ambulante, posee una moto con la que realiza los repartos y cobranzas de las mercaderías que vende. Anteriormente trabajaba como empleado en una empresa privada, su padre que dedica a lo mismo, lo apoyó para que se independizara y actualmente posee más de trescientos clientes en varios puntos del país.

El préstamo que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de jeans, remeras, calzados deportivos, zapatillas, sábanas, colchas, manteles, medias, etc.

loans.use: Purchase jeans, t-shirts, sports footwear, slippers, sheets, bedspreads, tablecloths, stockings, etc. to to meet customers' demands.

loans.name: Myrian

texts.es:
Mrs. Myrian P. is married to Santiago Valentín Gonzalez. They have three school-age children. He distributes books for the Santillanas Publishing House, while she has made blouses, boots, and student uniforms for the last five years.

Myrian has received numerous uniform orders for 2008, and she’d like to begin working on them. That’s why she needs this loan, which she will use to buy different types of fabric for her sewing.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Myrian P. está casada con Santiago Valentín Gonzalez. Ellos tienen 3 hijos en edad escolar. El distribuye libros de la Editorial Santillanas, mientras ella desde hace 5 años confecciona camisas, camperas y uniformes para estudiantes.

Myrian ha recibido un pedido numeroso ya de uniformes para el año 2008, por lo que desea empezar a trabajar en ello, para esto necesita de un crédito con los que comprara diferentes tipos de telas para su confección.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, threads, lace, and other sewing goods.

loans.name: Zunilda

texts.es:
Mrs. Zunilda O. has three daughters; she works with one of them in the city market selling used clothing for men, women, and children.

She told us that thanks to the low prices of her clothing, it is in great demand. She buys the clothing in Brazil, and travels once or twice a month to bring back her merchandise.

She is requesting a loan that she will use to buy clothing for the summer season, including t-shirts, shorts, Bermudas, pants, skirts, jeans, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Zunilda O. tiene tres hijas, trabaja con una de ellas en el mercado municipal vendiendo ropas usadas para damas, caballeros y niños.

Nos cuenta que gracias al precio accesible de sus ropas ella posee gran demanda de los mismos. Las ropas las compra de Brasil y viaja una o dos veces al mes a traer sus mercaderías.

Ella solicita un crédito con el que podrá adquirir ropa, para esta temporada de verano, tales como remeras, shorts, bermudas, pantalones, faldas, jeans, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of used t-shirts, shorts, Bermudas, pants, skirts, jeans, etc, to sell in the summer season.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Mr. Teófilo is 36 years old and married to Mrs. Yeda Agüero. He has a five year-old daughter and lives in a neighborhood close to the city center. He dedicates himself to the purchase and sales of general electronics and domestic electronic items like televisions, freezers, boom boxes, blenders, sandwich makers, etc.

He sells his items for cash or on credit. The business is located in the Luque market, where he has many customers. With the loan that he is requesting he would like to increase his inventory by acquiring radios, clocks, calculators, televisions and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

El señor Teófilo tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Yeda Agüero, tiene una hija de 5 años de edad, vive en un barrio cercano al centro de la ciudad, se dedica a la compra-venta de artículos electrónicos en general, y electrodomésticos como televisores, congeladores, minicomponentes, licuadoras, sandwicheras, etc.

Sus ventas la realiza ya sea al contado o a crédito, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de Luque, y nos cuenta que tiene bastante clientela. Con préstamo que solicita desea aumentar su inventario, adquiriendo radios, relojes, calculadoras, televisores y otros.

loans.use: Purchase of radios, clocks, calculators, televisions and other things

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es:
Mrs. Augusta A. is 58 years old. She is separated and has 3 children. Two of them are married and one daughter lives with her and both studies administration and works in order to contribute to the household income.

She started out with a small café where she served food for many patrons. After that, she learned how to make pastry and candy and opened up sweet shop in her home. She currently teaches pastry-making at a school near her home.

Augusta says that the loan will be of great use to her because it will be easier for her to obtain a discount on supplies if she pays in cash.

She is also preparing an area in her home to open up an ice cream parlor, taking advantage of the hot summer season. She is requesting this loan in order to buy milk, sugar, flour, vanilla extract, yeast, fruit, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Augusta tiene 58 años de edad, ella es separada, tiene 3 hijos dos de ellos casados y una hija que vive con ella que es estudiante de Administración, además trabaja, y también colabora con los gastos de la casa.

Augusta comenta que en sus inicios ella tenía un copetín, donde daba de comer a muchas personas, luego estudió repostería y confitería, entonces decidió abrir su microempresa de confitería en su domicilio. Actualmente enseña repostería en una escuela cerca de su casa.

Augusta dice que el crédito es de gran ayuda ya que le facilita la compra de sus materias primas, al contado, pues de esta forma obtiene mejores descuentos.

Actualmente está preparando espacio en su casa para habilitar una heladería, aprovechando la época de mucho calor. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como leche, azúcar, harina, esencia de vainilla, levadura, frutas, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of confectioner’s supplies such as milk, sugar, flour, vanilla extract, yeast, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Mrs. Catalina P. is 48 years old and married to Mr. Lorenzo Macedo who is 49 years old. They have 6 children, three of which are married and live with their respective families. The three younger children live at home. One child is 20 years old and works at a supermarket in a city near the capital. The other two children (12 and 9 years old) are making their way through elementary school.

Mrs. Catalina has had a store for 8 years. It is located in a new neighborhood where it is practically the only business. She would like to invest the loan she is requesting into the purchase of merchandise like rice, sugar, flour and herbs. When purchased in big bags these items cost less and thus aid in bringing in more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La señora Catalina P. tiene 48 años y esta casada con el señor Lorenzo Macedo que tiene 49 años. Tienen 6 hijos, 3 de ellos ya están casados y viven con sus respectivas familias, y los 3 menores aún viven con ellos, uno de 20 años que trabaja en un supermercado de una ciudad cercana a la capital y dos niños de 12 y 9 años respectivamente que están cursando sus estudios primarios.

La sra. Catalina tiene su despensa desde hace 8 años y esta ubicada en un barrio nuevo donde prácticamente es el único negocio por lo que desea invertir el préstamo que solicita en la compra de mercaderías como ser arroz, azúcar, harina y yerba por bolsas de esta forma el costo de los mismos es más barato y ayuda a que las ganancias sean mayores.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise like rice, sugar, flour and herbs

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia González is 41 years old, is married and her husband is a public transportation driver. Lidia has had a food store for twenty years, which is called “San Luis.”

She wishes to invest the loan that she is soliciting in the purchase of products like flour, rice, sugar, oil and other staple products since, in this season of the year, there is more demand for these types of products for the holiday and new year celebrations.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

La sra. Lidia González tiene 41 años es casada, y su marido es chofer de una empresa de transporte publico. Lidia tiene una despensa desde hace 20 años cuyo nombre es San Luis.

Desea invertir el préstamo que solicita en la compra de mercaderías como harina, arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros productos de primera necesidad en general, ya que en esta época del año tiene mayor demanda de dichas mercaderías por las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo.

loans.use: Purchase of products such as flour, rice, sugar, oil and other staple products.

texts.es:
Máximo R. is 52 years old, has been part of a couple for 30 years and has two daughters: one is 28 years old and is married and the other is 20 years old and she is a student and lives with her parents.

Máximo has a carpentry shop in his home. His father was also a carpenter and, as a result, he learned this trade.

He started his own carpentry shop many years ago and says that it has done well and that his work is well appreciated by his customers. His specialty is the construction of closet furniture, modular furniture, beds, game tables, and chairs.

He says that the credit is a very important tool for his small business because, with it, he can satisfy current demand. Today, he is soliciting a credit so that he may buy wood for his furniture making.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción: El Sr. Máximo Rodríguez, tiene 52 años de edad, está en pareja hace 30 años, tiene dos hijas una de 28 años que ya está casada y la otra tiene 20 años, ella es estudiante, y vive con ellos.

El Sr. Máximo tiene una carpintería en su domicilio; según nos comentó, su padre también fue carpintero y mediante él conoció el oficio de su profesión.

Ha montado su propia carpintería hace varios años, cuenta que le va muy bien y que sus trabajos son muy apreciados por los clientes. Su especialidad es la fabricación de muebles para placard, modulares, camas, juego de mesas y sillas.

Dice que el crédito es una herramienta muy importante para su microempresa, pues de ello depende que pueda satisfacer la demanda de pedidos que se le presenta. Hoy solicita un crédito para poder comprar madera para la elaboración de sus muebles.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Ms. Olga R. is 55 years old, single and mother of three children. The oldest is 29 years old and works as an administrative assistant at an underware elaboration factory. The 24 years old son is studying Business Administration. Finally, the youngest daughter, 19 years old, is a student and was awarded a full scholarship, which she is using right now, to attend Public Notary school.

Ms. Olga has run her diner for 20 years, where she sells turnovers, cakes and breaded steaks, which she elaborates herself. She also sells beverages, such as soda, beer and wines.

She wishes to invest the loan in the purchase of beers, sodas and ciders, as the present holiday season is when sales are greater.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Olga R. tiene 55 años, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos. El mayor tiene 29 años y trabaja como auxiliar administrativo en una empresa de confección de ropa interior, otro de 24 años está estudiando administración de empresas y la menor, que tiene 19 años, es estudiante y obtuvo una beca completa para la carrera de Notariado Público, que esta usufructuando en este momento.

La Sra. Olga tiene su copetín desde hace 20 años donde vende comida rápida de su propia elaboración como empanadas, tortillas y milanesas. También vende bebidas como gaseosas, cervezas y vinos.

Desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de cervezas, gaseosas y sidras, ya que en esta época es donde mayor venta tiene, debido a las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: Purchase of beverages: sodas, beers and wines.

loans.name: Rosa De Jesus

texts.es:
Mrs. M. is an entrepreneurial, single mother of six children, of which three are still in her care. Rosita strives day after day so that her children may get ahead. As a result of an illness, she had to stop her business which hampered her economically. Two years ago, she restarted her business with barely $100 and, with the financing that she has received from Apoyo Integral, she has been able to increase that little by little and earn what she needs to furnish the business and move it forward. This credit will be the sixth managed with the institution. Her business is located outsiD. in one of the principle street of the city, which makes it easy for customers to see the different styles that she sells. Currently, she needs financing to buy new styles of clothing, including clothing for men, women and children.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra M., es una persona emprendedora madre soltera D. seis hijos, D. los cuales tres están todavía a su cargo, niña Rosita como le gusta que le digan lucha día tras día para sacar adelante a sus hijos ella comenta que por una enfermedad desistió del negocio lo cual la perjudico economicamete , hace dos años que a reiniciado su negocio con apenas $100,0 y con los financiamientos que a recibido por parte D. Apoyo Integral a podido incrementarlo poco a poco y obtener las ganancias para surtirlo y poder salir adelante con sus gastos, con este crédito seria el séptimo manejado con la institución ,su negocio esta ubicado en una D. las calles principales D. la ciudad se encuentra al aire libre lo cual facilita para que sus clientes puedan ver y medirse los distintos estilos que ella venD. , su financiamiento actualmente lo necesita para comprar nuevos estilos entre ellos ropa D. mujer niño y hombres.

loans.use: Purchase of new styles of clothing including women’s skirts, men’s and children’s clothing since there is a lot of demand right now.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Zuleyma Arely

texts.es:
The applicant actually lives in La Libertad, her family group consists of three children who directly depend of her earnings. They are the inspiration for her to move ahead in life. She's been improving her business throughout the years with the addition of a mill after noticing people coming to her and asking for some of these items. Financing through "Apoyo Integral" have helped her improve her services and helped her not say "no" to any of her clients who come to her looking for a specific item. With her last loan she purchased basic grains and as of today, its been a great investment which has given her more earnings.

The loan she requests is to buy a vehicle since she needs to deliver her grains to the people in the area. At this moment she rents a car, which is more of an inconvenience. The applicant has had a good record with the institution and all the loans have been paid back.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La solicitante vive actualmente en La Libertad su grupo familiar lo componen tres hijos que dependen directamente de sus ingresos y que son la inspiración de ella para salir adelante ella a ido incrementando su negocio con el paso de los años inicio con un molino al ver que las personas que llegaban solicitaban algunos productos decidido poner una tienda los financiamientos de Apoyo Integral le ayudan para poder mejorar su servicio y no decir a los clientes que no tiene el producto que buscan además en su ultimo financiamiento compro granos básicos y hasta la fecha a sido una buena inversión ya que le deja mas ganancia y otros ingresos extras. El financiamiento lo necesita para poder comprar un vehículo ya que con la venta de granos básicos tiene rutas para poder repartir ya que por el momento tiene que alquilar lo cual le genera mas inconvenientes, la señora a tenido un buen récord crediticio con la institución y todos los financiamientos han sido bien invertidos.

loans.use: Mrs. Hernandez needs to purchase a vehicle since it's difficult for her to transport  basic grains and items from her store to clients in the area.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Ms. Marlene lives in La Libertad and is the single mother of two children, who depend on her income. She learned sewing and dressmaking in order to make a living for her family. She has 10 years of experience in the business, and this has greatly contributed to her good reputation as a dressmaker in the area. She offers tailoring services, along with the production of garments that she distributes to markets and bazaars of nearby regions. She started her business with very little, but has made a great effort to grow, in spite of the difficulties imposed by being the sole provider for her family. She needs the loan in order to stock on the fabrics that she sells to her clients, as well as on accessories for the production of the garments sold to the bazaars.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Marlene vive en La Libertad y es madre soltera de dos hijos, que dependen de sus ingresos. Aprendió costura ya que se vió en la necesidad de obtener ingresos y poder sacar adelante a su familia. Hasta la fecha tiene diez años de experiencia en este negocio, lo cual ha contribuido en gran manera para que las personas de la zona la reconozcan como una buen costurera. Los servicios que ella presta son la costura a medida y elaboración de prendas de vestir para distribuir en los mercados y bazares de la zonas aledañas. Ella inició su negocio con poco, pero ha tratado en gran manera de poder ir incrementándolo, aunque no le ha sido fácil, ya que tiene que correr con todos los gastos de su grupo familiar. El financiamiento lo necesita para surtir las telas que vende a sus clientes y accesorios para la elaboración de prendas para los bazares.

loans.use: She is in the dressmaking business and needs to purchase fabrics and accessories for the garments she will sell in the present season.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

payments.comment: This entrepreneur has prepaid the balance on her loan. She is very grateful for your loan and appreciates your support.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Ms. L. lives in La Libertad, with her three children. They depend on her income and that of her husband, who works as a labourer. Since her husband’s income was barely sufficient to go by, she decided to start her business, selling seafood by retail. She presently sells as a peddler in nearby cities. She has been in the business for four years and considers it a way of helping her husband with expenses, in order to provide her family with a better education. She is requesting the loan in order to sell different products demanded by her clients, such as fish and prawns.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

la Sra. L. vive en La Libertad con sus tres hijos. Ellos dependen de sus ingresos y los de su esposo, que trabaja de jornalero, algo que la impulsó a emprender su negocio de venta de mariscos al por menor, ya que los ingresos que generaba su esposo apenas le alcanzaban para sobrevivir. Actualmente vende de forma ambulante en algunas ciudades cercanas a donde vive. Tiene cuatro años de dedicarse a esa actividad y considera que de esa manera puede ayudar a su esposo con algunos gastos y así poder proveer a su familia con una mejor educación. Solicita el financiamiento para vender otros productos demandados por sus clientes, tales como pescado y camarones.

loans.use: Purchase of fish and prawns, products demanded by her clients.

payments.comment: This entrepreneur has prepaid the balance on her loan. She is very grateful for your loan and appreciates your support.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria was born in the Huarochiri province in the department of Lima. She is married, has 4 children and is 37 years old. Currently her husband's work is temporary. He is a bricklayer and the money that he receives in exchange for his work is insufficient to cover all of the basic necessities. It is because of this that Maria maD. the decision to help with the expenses. She remembered that from the time she was very little her mother taught her that all work is dignified. It is due to this that she began to sell plants and natural products since the late 90s. Thanks to the good use of her earnings she has been able to make her business bigger and help with the expenses of the home.

Maria's dream is to have her own place to sell her items that is much bigger and more secure, as well as to acquire more merchandise to be able to fulfill the requests of her clients. This will enable her to have more money and to invest it in the most important thing for her and her family, the education of the children, so that they can finish their basic studies in primary and secondary school and continue with higher education so that they don't repeat the same history as EsteL..

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer.

María nació en L. Provincia D. Huarochiri – Departamento D. Lima. Es casada, tiene 4 hijos y tiene 37 años D. edad. Actualmente el trabajo que tiene su esposo es eventual, realiza trabajos D. albañilería y el dinero que recibe a cambio es insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades básicas; es por ello, que Maria toma L. decisión D. colaborar con los gastos; recordó que desD. muy pequeña L. madre les enseño que todo trabajo es digno es por ello que empieza a vender plantas y productos naturales caseros desD. fines D. los años 90. Gracias al buen uso que le está dando a sus ingresos ha podido ampliar su negocio y ayudar con los gastos del hogar. El sueño D. María es contar con un puesto propio mucho más amplio y seguro, además D. adquirir más mercadería para poder cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes y que eso le permita tener mas dinero e invertirlo en lo mas importante par elL. y su familia, L. educación D. los hijos, para que ellos puedan concluir sus estudios básicos D. primaria y secundaria y seguir estudios superiores para que no se repita L. misma historia D. elL..

loans.use: To acquire merchandise for her plant and natural products business.

texts.es:
Felix was born in the Ayacucho department. He decided to migrate to the capital because he had heard of a distant cousin that had a artisan weaving workshop in Lurin. Thanks to God, as was mentioned, he received it and gave him work. He began to concentrate all his energy in learning all the techniques of weaving and thanks to the fine finish of his products, the same people that were clients of his family motivated him to begin his own business because his work was of a very high quality and they wanted to do direct business with him. Married with two children, he made the decision to seek a place to live and have a workshop.

The money that he was able to save was enough to acquire land in the high area and he also bought some very rustic, small artisan weaving machines. He still works with them because his budget is not enough. Now there are seven members of his household: him, his wife, their four children and his brother who came to the town and asked him for work.

His artisan weavings are made with Alpaca, Ovino and Llama wool. They have a good finish and it is because of this that his market is basically the exclusive areas of the capital that recognize the quality of the product and pay a fair price. Felix, now 36 years old, has a dream, to be able to have a bigger workshop to give work to more people in his town that are known for this kind of work, as this will allow him to learn and prevent his family from feeling hunger and cold.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer.

Félix nació en el Departamento de Ayacucho. Decide migrar a la capital porque había escuchado de un primo lejano que tenia un taller de tejidos artesanales en Lurín, Gracias a Dios, como menciona, lo recibió y le dio trabajo. Empezó a concentrar toda su energía para aprender todas las técnicas de tejido y gracias al buen acabado de sus productos, los mismos clientes que eran del familiar lo motivaron a que iniciara su propio negocio porque sus trabajos eran de muy buena calidad y querían hacer el trato directo con él. Ya casado y con la presencia de 2 hijos toma la decisión de buscar un terreno donde vivir y poner un taller. El dinero que había logrado ahorrar le alcanzó para adquirir su terreno en la parte alta de un cerro y además compró unas pequeñas máquinas tejedoras artesanales muy rústicas; aún sigue trabajando con ellas porque su presupuesto no le alcanza, ahora son siete integrantes en casa, él, su esposa, sus cuatro hijos y su hermano que vino de su pueblo y le ha pedido trabajo. Sus tejidos artesanales son elaborados con lana de Alpaca, Ovino y Llama; tienen buen acabado, es por ello que su mercado es básicamente en zonas exclusivas de la capital que reconocen la calidad del producto y pagan el precio justo. Félix, hoy con sus 36 años tiene un anhelo, poder tener un taller amplio para dar trabajo a mas personas de su pueblo quienes son conocedores de este tipo de trabajo, además que esto le permita aprender y evite que su familia pasen hambre y frío.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Ms. Maxima has lived in Chosica for 30 years. She has 5 children and is a single mother.

She began to sell clothing house to house to be able to provide her children with food. Her business was good for her and that's how she could open a small store in her house. Her neighbors know the situation of what happened to her and so they support her by buying her products and this allows her to move her children forward, providing them with the education that she could not have.

Now she is in charge of two of her children, ages 4 and 12. She is giving them the education that she and the older children could not have.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer.

La señora reside hace 30 años en Chosica, tiene 5 hijos, es madre soltera. Empezó vendiendo ropa ofreciendo de casa en casa, para poder brindarles alimentación a sus hijos, su negocio le fue bien y es así como pudo abrir una pequeña bodega en su casa, sus vecinos conociendo la situación por la que pasaba la señora, la apoyaron comprándole sus productos y es así como la señora pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos, brindarle los estudios que ella no pudo tener. Ahora esta a cargo de dos de sus hijos de 4 y 12 años, les está dando la educación que ella y sus hijos mayores no pudieron tener.

loans.use: To increase the variety of products in her store

texts.es:
Mr. B. D. has lived in Chosica for 6 years. He and his wife come from the Junin and Puno departments respectively. They have two children, 6 months and 12 years old.

Initially they sold food and breakfast where they gave out food roving through the markets of Chosica. They saved their money little by little to be able to have a store and to provide themselves with commodities for their children that they themselves could not have.

His goal is that his children become professionals so that they can have a better quality of life and so that the same difficulties do not happen to them. For this he exerts himself every day so that his business is profitable and gives his children the basic necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer.

El señor vive hace 6 años en Chosica, él y su esposa vienen de los departamentos de Junín y Puno respectivamente, tienen 2 hijos de 6 meses y 12 años. Inicialmente se dedicaron a la venta de comida y desayuno en donde repartían ambulatoriamente a los señores de los mercados de Chosica, fueron ahorrando poco a poco su dinero para poner una tienda y poder brindarles las comodidades a sus hijos, ya que ellos no lo pudieron tener. Su meta es que sus hijos sean profesionales para que así puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y no pasen las dificultades que ellos pasaron, por eso se esfuerzan cada día para que su negocio les sea rentable y darles las comodidades básicas a sus hijos.

Antonio O. is a very responsible and hardworking gentleman. He is married and has two children, so he struggles to sustain his family. Using his savvy in the jewelry field, Mr. O. has been efficiently making and repairing jewelry for 3 years.

He is currently working in the Chinandega market. He had rough beginnings in this business because he used to borrow tools from other people and did not have a display case in which to place his jewelry.

Currently, Mr. O. has invested in his business with Ceprodel loans—at total of 25—which he has wisely spent buying his own work tools, improving his shop, and providing an education for his 2 children who so urgently need it.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonio O. es un caballero muy responsable y trabajador. Casado y con dos hijos a su cargo se esfuerza para sustentar a su núcleo familiar. Desde hace 3 años el señor O. se dedica a la elaboración y reparación de joyas el cual se ha desempeñado con mucha eficiencia por ser muy conocedor en este ramo.

Actualmente se encuentra laborando en el mercado de Chinandega, sus inicios fueron bastante difíciles puesto que comenzó a trabajar con herramientas prestadas y no teniendo alguna vitrina donde colocar las joyas.

Actualmente el señor O. ha invertido en su negocio por medio de créditos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel (25 créditos) que los ha utilizado muy sabiamente para comprar sus propias herramientas de trabajo, para mejorar su local y también para poder continuar brindándole los estudios a sus dos hijos que tanto lo necesitan.

For 14 years, Mr. Benigno G.'s business has been making and repairing shoes. He developed this ability very early on in the city of Chinandega in Nicaragua.

Currently Mr. Benigno is married and also has 4 children that are his responsibility to support them all since they are all in primary school.

Mr. Benigno remembers the start of his business very well. He began with an investment of C$200, which he used to buy a safe to keep his tools in and to walk around his neighborhood.

Today his business has grown due to the fact that two years ago he got 18 credits from Ceprodel which he used to acquire more primary materials to make a larger production of shoes and also to support the education of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer.

Desde hace 14 años, el negocio del señor Benigno Gutiérrez ha sido la elaboración y reparación de zapatos. Esta habilidad la desarrolló desde muy pequeño en la ciudad de Chinandega en Nicaragua.

Actualmente el señor Benigno es casado y además tienen 4 hijos a su responsabilidad con el deber de mantenerlos puesto que todos ellos estudian en la primaria.

El inicio de su negocio es muy recordado por el señor Benigno ya que comenzó con una inversión de C$ 200 los cuales los usó para comprar una caja para guardar las herramientas y salir ambulante en el sector de su localidad.

Hoy en día su negocio ha proliferado debido a que desde hace 2 años ha realizado 18 créditos en Ceprodel los cuales le han servido en la adquisición de mayor materia prima par realizar mayores producciones de zapatos y además para el apoyo en la educaron de sus hijos.

loans.name: Estela Alexander

texts.es:
Estela Alexander Guzman D. Cubias resides in Ciudad Arce. Her husband works in a clothing factory but the money that he makes is very little to proviD. for the family since they have three small children. Due to this, Estela helps him by selling basic grains such as beans, corn, etc. from the house and also is seeking an alternative income with the commercialization of clothing in small quantities. The requested loan is to buy more basic grains and clothes with the goal of beginning to sell more and generate more income that will help her to realize her dream that she wishes for so badly, which is to proviD. her children with all the necessary things so that they grow up happy in a healthy environment with the best conditions of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer.

Estela Alexánder Gúzman D. Cubias, resiD. en Ciudad Arce, su esposo trabaja en una fábrica D. ropa, pero el dinero que gana es muy poco para sostener a la familia ya que tienen 3 hijos pequeños, debido a ello Estela le ayuda vendiendo en la casa granos básicos como frijol, maíz, etc. tambien a buscado como alternativa D. ingresos la comercialización D. ropa en pequeñas cantidades, el prestamo solicitado es para comprar más granos básicos y ropa con el afán D. empezar a vender por mayoreo y generar con ello más ingresos que le ayuden a realizar el sueño que tanto anela que es brindarle a sus hijos todo lo necesario para que crezcan felices en un ambiente sano y con mejores condiciones D. vida..

loans.use: To buy basic grains such as beans, corn and also clothes

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

texts.es:
Mr. Blismar S. sells groceries and home products. He has had this business in the city of Chinandega for a year, starting out with only a few products and stocking it with new products as the months passed.

Mr. S. is a single dad with one son under his care. His son is a student at Chinandega Elementary School.

Since he started his business, Ceprodel has provided Mr. S. with loans that have been of great benefit. Thanks to these loans, he has been able to restock his store. He wishes to continue investing in his business so that he may become one of the best merchants of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica el señor Blismar S. es a la venta de abarrotarías o artículos del hogar. Tiene su propia distribuidora desde hace 1 año iniciándola con pocos productos y a medida que pasan los meses la ha venido surtiendo con nuevos productos que ofrece en la ciudad de Chinandega.

El señor Blismar es padre soltero y con un hijo a su responsabilidad el cual cursa sus estudios de primaria en el colegio de Chinandega.

Desde que inició su negocio, ha tomado la decisión de trabajar con Ceprodel habiendo recibido créditos que le han ayudado a salir adelante en su negocio de manera que ha podido surtir sus estantes y son sus deseos continuar invirtiendo en su negocio para así poder convertirse en uno de los mejores comerciantes de su ciudad.

Ms. Felipa T.’s business is flowers and shoes' sales, in the city of Chinandega. She started a year ago as a peddler, but her age as well as the sun exposure led her to settle in one place, in order to prevent any health issues. She has presently been assigned a spot at the boulevard of the Chinandega market, where she works selling by retail.

It is important to point out that, in a short period, she has obtained a total of three loans from Ceprodel, which have allowed her to improve her business, by buying a higher volume of merchandise, as well as by acquiring novel flower products, which she sells at the Chinandega market.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio a que se dedica la señora Felipa T. es a la comercialización de flores junto con la venta de chinelas en la ciudad de Chinandega. Su negocio lo inició hace un año vendiendo ambulante en las calles, pero su edad y la exposición al sol dieron lugar a que la señora T. se estableciera en un solo lugar para evitar daños a su salud. Hoy en da la señora Felipa ha conseguido un tramo en el bulevar del mercado de Chinandega, donde se desempeña vendiendo los productos al detalle.

Es necesario destacar que desde hace poco tiempo, ella ha obtenido créditos en Ceprodel acumulando un total de 3 créditos, que a pesar de que sean pocos ha podido contemplar mejoras en su negocio, como lo son la compra de mayores volúmenes de ventas y de igual forma la adquisición de nuevos productos florales que los vende en el sector del mercado de la ciudad de Chinandega.

loans.name: Nidia Aracely

texts.es:
Ms. Nidia Aracely H. M. is a single mother who lives in Ciudad Arce. Her sole source of income is a bakery and confectionary business that helps her support her 3 children. She works hard with the hopes of improving her family’s quality of life. She learned her trade at a young age from her father, who was a baker. She is requesting a loan in order to boost production by buying the supplies needed for making her products and buying a bicycle so that she can easily deliver the bread that her customers order. She is starting to get more orders now, and she would like to offer an efficient and speedy service. All of these things will increase her income, which will in turn allow her to improve her children’s lives.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nidia Aracely H. M. vive en Ciudad Arce, es madre soltera, su fuente de ingresos es el negocio de panaderia y reposteria del cual sostiene a sus tres hijos, lucha cada día con la esperanza de lograr mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia. Este oficio lo aprendio desde muy pequeña ya que su padre era panadero y le enseño, ella requiere de un prestamo para aumentar su capacidad productiva através de la compra de más insumos para la elaboraciòn de sus productos y a la vez comprar una bicicleta para lograr repartir con mayor facilidad los pedidos que le hacen de pan ya que empieza a tener pedidos por encargos y quiere ofrecer un servicio más rápido y eficiente. Todo esto le dara más ingresos que le permitiran hacer realidad esa mejora de vida que quiere para sus hijos..

loans.use: Purchase of flour, butter, and a bicycle

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

payments.comment: This entrepreneur has prepaid the balance on her loan. She is very grateful for your loan and appreciates your support.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Mrs. Julia is a very enthusiastic and enterprising woman. Her family is made up of herself, her husband and four daughters (ages 23, 20, 15 and 13). Her husband works at Peru Ceramics (Ñaña).

About ten years ago, they decided to start a pottery business, Handcrafted Ceramics Shop, with two gas and wood kilns handcrafted by her husband. They produced a variety of ceramic items (feeders, water dispensers, vases for flowers, urns, flowerpots, cups, Keros (beakers based on ancient designs) and others) based on the desires of their clients.

Currently their main products are the tiled feeders and water dispensers for birds, rabbits and guinea pigs. Their production for Purina has reached between 800 and 1000 pieces per week.

They currently buy about 15 to 20 tons of clay for four months of production and due to the increase in local demand have three operators. They have plans to market to other provinces and outside of the country and are in the process of implementing these business plans. They are aware that additional capital investment will be needed to respond to the increased demand that will result from the expansion of the business. They need to acquire an electric kiln, more tons of clay, increased number of workers, etc.

Julia wants the loan to buy an additional kiln. This will give her the resources to improve the education of her daughters. The oldest daughter is studying business administration and they all help with the painting of the pottery.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Julia es una entusiasta y emprendedora mujer, su familia esta constituida por ella, su esposo y 4 hijas (23,20,15 y 3 años), su esposo trabaja en Cerámica Perú (Ñaña).

Decidieron emprender desde hace aprox. 10 años la formación de su Taller Artesanal de Cerámica, con 2 hornos construidos artesanalmente por el esposo a gas y leña, elaboran diversos modelos de cerámicas (bebederos, comederos, floreros, jarrones, maceteros, tazas, Keros y otros), de acuerdo a los requerimientos de sus clientes.

Actualmente su principal producto son los bebederos y comederos enlosados para aves, conejos y cuyes llegando a elaborar entre 800 y 1000 piezas semanalmente para Purina.

Actualmente compra aprox. 15 a 20 toneladas para 4 meses, cuenta con 3 operarios debido a que se ha incrementado sus pedidos a nivel local, tiene la visión de abrirse mercado a provincias y al extranjero el cual esta en proceso de tramites para la formalización del negocio, adquirir un horno eléctrico, ya que tiene pleno conocimiento que requerirá de mas capital para poder afrontar los requerimientos en grandes cantidades el cual pasa por ampliar taller, mayor toneladas de arcilla, incrementar números de trabajadores y otros.

Julia desea comprar un horno y así mejorar la educación de sus hijas (la mayor esta estudiando administración y apoyan en las pinturas de las cerámicas).

loans.use: Purchase of materials such as a kiln to produce pottery.

texts.es:
Two years ago, in the city of Chinandega, Ms. Karla P. decided to begin her own business in food sales. It is for this reason that she used her small savings to start this business.

As all beginnings are difficult, Ms. P. trasversed through situations where her sales were relatively scarce and at the same time her worry grew for the simple fact that she is a single mother with three small children to provide for. Two of these children are school age.

As with all Nicaraguan mothers, Ms. P. has continued motivating herself to improve the situation of her business. She decided to get loans from Ceprodel (she has obtained 15 credits) which have impacted her directly by bringing her benefits with the food that has increased her earnings. She has been an excellent mother to her 2 children.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer.

Desde hace dos años, en la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Karla P. decide iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comida. Es por esta razón que utiliza sus pocos ahorros para iniciar este negocio.

Como todo inicio es difícil, la señora P. atravesó por situaciones en las cuales sus ventas eran relativamente escasas y a la vez su preocupación crecía por el simple hecho de que es madre soltera y con tres pequeños a quienes mantener. Dos de estos están en la etapa escolar.

Como toda mujer Nicaragüense, la señora P. ha seguido esforzándose de manera que ha mejorado la situación de su negocio. Decide realizar prestamos en Ceprodel (ha obtenido 15 créditos) los cuales han impactado de manera directa trayéndole beneficios en su establecimiento de comida por lo que ha aumentado sus ganancias y ha sido una excelente madre para sus hijos.

Mrs. Magda sells vegetables at the Chinandega market. She is married and has 4 children who attend elementary school.

She started her business 15 years ago, selling small quantities of vegetables. Sometimes she did not sell any at all, but over the years she has been able to acquire more customers who are loyal to her even today.

Cognizant of the fact that she must provide for her family, she has obtained 3 loans from Ceprodel, loans that have helped her improve her business and will facilitate her goal of one day seeing her children obtain professional degrees.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica la señora Magda es a la venta de verduras en el mercado de Chinandega. Es una mujer casada y con 4 hijos que cursan sus estudios en la educación primaria.

Su negocio inició hace 15 años con la venta de pequeñas cantidades de verduras que en ocasiones ni siquiera las vendía pero a través de los años ha podido ganar clientes que hasta hoy en día se mantienen fieles a la señora Magda.

Consiente de la necesidad de mantener su núcleo familiar, la señora Magda ha realizado alianza con Ceprodel obteniendo 3 créditos que le han sido de mucho apoyo para mejorar su negocio y seguir luchando por el sueño de llegar a tener hijos profesionales.

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
The communal bank Rubí was begun eleven years ago. Currently there are 26 members, and they have spent 34 seasons together. The founding members were Marcelina, Ceverina, Victoria, Dora, and Fortunata. In the communal bank, members learn to be punctual and responsible, to improve their self-esteem, to organize their daily activities better, and, above all, to save their money. The members manage different businesses, including selling groceries, pots and pans, vegetables, oils, coca, meat, clothing, jewelry; making cheeses and furniture; growing avocado, and performing various artisan tasks, including weaving.

Each member has her own store to tell, as in the case of Marcelina, who began her business traveling to markets twice a week with very few goods, and now goes to more fairs with stocked merchandise. Marcelina counts on two motor-taxis that she was able to buy using her savings from the communal bank to bring in additional income. Apart from these businesses, she makes typical regional clothing, including wedding gowns.

On the other hand, Fortunata weaves beautiful sweaters and skirts that she sells at markets. At first, Fortunata only sold garments she wove, and now, she sells fabric clothing and a wiD. variety of styles.

The members need different amounts for the loans, adding up to a total of $4,450 in loans from the communal bank. The loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, milk, oil, wool, dyes, cheese molds, pork, mutton, wood, lacquer, paint, corn, wheat, lubricants, coca, carrots, onions, and squash.

Their savings will be used for the education of their children, additional cash, an emergency, and future needs. The dreams of these women incluD. having a sawmill, having a larger business, running a business raising guinea pigs and generating biofuels, being a businesswoman selling jewelry, and getting their children ahead as good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Rubí se inició hace 11 años. Actualmente son 26 socias y ya tienen 34 ciclos juntas. Las socias fundadoras fueron Marcelina, Ceverina, Victoria, Dora y Fortunata. En el Banco Comunal las socias aprendieron a ser puntuales, responsables, a mejorar su autoestima, organizar mejor sus actividades diarias y sobre todo a ahorrar. Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes, ollas, verduras, lubricantes, coca, carne, ropa, joyería, la elaboración D. quesos, producción D. palta, fabricación D. muebles, feriantes y artesanía en telar. Cada socia tiene una historia que contar, como es el caso D. Marcelina, quien inició su negocio viajando a las ferias, 2 veces por semana, y con muy poca mercadería, y actualmente viaja a más ferias con mercadería surtida. Marcelina cuenta que con los ahorros que pudo reunir en su Banco Comunal compró 2 mototaxis que le generan más ingresos, además D. estos negocios, Marcelina hace ropa típica D. la zona como fustanes. Por otro lado Fortunata teje bellas chompas y enaguas, que venD. en las ferias. Al inicio Fortunata solo vendía prendas elaboradas por ella y, actualmente, venD. ropa D. fábrica y variedad D. modelos, Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 400 soles, 600 soles, 800 soles, haciendo un total D. 13,200 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra arroz, leche, aceite, lanas, tintes, moldes para hacer quesos, cerdo, carnero, madera, laca, pintura, maíz, trigo, lubricantes, coca, zanahoria, zapallo, cebolla. Los ahorros los utilizarán para la educación D. sus hijos, tener un capital mas granD., alguna urgencia y para el futuro. Los sueños D. las socias son tener un aserradero, un negocio mas granD., tener una empresa D. crianza D. cuyes y generar biogás, ser empresario en la venta D. joyas y que sus hijos salgan adelante siendo buenos profesionales.

loans.use: Investing in purchasing a wide variety of goods for many businesses, including foodstuffs, crafts, vegetables, and meats.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.es:
Marilyn has lived in the Armando Villanueva community ever since she met her husband there thirteen years ago, and they now have four daughters. She is a pharmacy technician, and came to run her own pharmacy. She couldn’t keep up the pharmacy because it needed more investment than she could afford. Now she has her grocery/general store, which she has had for a year and a half. Her husband helped buy a refrigerator, which she uses to sell jello, soda, and ice. She would like to get financing to buy a display freezer where she could sell ice cream, and to buy plush toys for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Vive en el AAHH Armando Villanueva desde que tenia 13 años ahí conoció a su esposo con el cual tiene 4 hijas, ella es técnica en Farmacia y llegó a tener su propia botica, No pudo continuar con su botica porque necesitaba más inversión la cual no pudo financiar, ahora tiene su bodega la cual tiene un año y medio. Su esposo le ayudó a comprar una refrigeradora con la cual vende gelatina, gaseosas y hielo. Desearía obtener financiamiento para comprar una congeladora –exhibidor donde vender helados de crema y comprar peluches para vender.

loans.use: Run and stock her grocery / general store.

texts.es:
Selling clothing is a very competitive business because there are several people in this trade in the Chinandega market. Nevertheless, Mrs. Maria M. has dedicated herself to this business for the past 15 years. The difficulty of the business isn’t important to her because she is a hard-working woman with a great drive to get ahead.

Mrs. M. is a widow with one daughter that she must support, and although she doesn’t have the support of her partner (due to his absence), she has done everything she can get ahead and improve her quality of life.

In the past three years, Mrs. M. has had 18 credits through Ceprodel, which she has used in part to improve her business by buying larger quantities of clothing to sell. Another part she has used to rebuild her house and buy food for her little daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de ropa es un negocio muy competitivo por el hecho de que en el mercado de Chinandega son varias las personas que se dedican a este negocio. Sin embargo, a pesar de esta situación la señora Maria M. desde hace 15 años se ha dedicado a este negocio, no importándole lo difícil que es mantener este negocio pues ella es una mujer muy esforzada y con gran espíritu de superación.

Actualmente la señora M. es una mujer viuda y con una hija a la que debe mantener y apear que no cuenta con el apoyo de su cónyuge por su ausencia, ella ha hecho todo lo posible por salir adelante y mejorar su nivel de vida.

La señora M. ha realizado desde hace tres años 18 créditos en Ceprodel por lo que ha mejorado en parte la condición de su negocio primeramente comprando mayores volúmenes de ropa para su comercialización y a la vez para poder reconstruir su casa y darle el alimento a su pequeña hija la cual es su responsabilidad.

Mr. Noel T. sells and repairs jewelry for a living. He started his business 9 years ago with $1,000 Nicaraguan Cordoba that he was able to save while working as a jewelry shop assistant.

Over the years, Mr. T. has invested more and more into his business, buying materials and upgrading his shop. In order to achieve these goals, Ceprodel has provided him with a total of 15 loans in the past 2 years. These loans have made a great impact on his business because he has been able update his work tools and has obtained a shop in which to run his business. Mr. T. stands out as being an excellent worker in the jewelry business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta y reparación de joyas es el negocio al que se dedica el caballero Noel T.. Inició hace 9 años con un capital propio de C$ 1,000 productos de ahorros que realizó cuando trabajaba de ayudante en otra joyería.

A medida que han venido transcurriendo los años, el señor T. ha decidido invertir cada vez mas en su negocio con la compra de nuevos materiales de trabajo y la remodelación de su negocio. Para poder haber realizado este avance, el señor T. se ha apoyado de los créditos que le ha brindado Ceprodel (15 créditos) desde hace 2 años. Cabe señalar que esto ha realizado un fuerte impacto en el negocio porque ha podido modernizar sus herramientas de trabajo y además ha adquirido un local donde realizar su trabajo que por cierto se destaca por ser un excelente trabajador en este ramo.

loans.name: Nora Carolina

texts.es:
Nora Carolina Gonzáles is a hardworking woman who sells fast food (hot dogs and chicken with fries) and compact discs. She started her business 5 years ago, using a cart to sell her products on the streets of Chinandega.

Months later, upon realizing that she needed to invest in her business, she sought the help of Ceprodel, which provided her with 6 loans that have helped her improve her economic status. These loans have helped her both increase her fast food sales and purchase greater quantities of CD’s to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Nora Carolina Gonzáles es una dama esforzada que se dedica al negocio de venta de comida (hot dog y pollo con papas) y al mismo tiempo venta de discos compactos.
