Su negocio inició hace 5 años en la ciudad de Chinandega con un carretón que le servía para trabajos ambulantes en las calles de esta ciudad.

Al pasar los meses y darse cuenta de que necesitaba invertir en su negocio, recurrió a Ceprodel por el cual le benefició ya que obtuvo 6 créditos que hoy en día le han ayudado a superar su situación económica aumentando sus ventas de comida y adquiriendo mayores cantidades de discos compactos para comercializarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of food and compact discs

texts.es:
Maria was born in Cajamarca and was a primary school teacher until six years ago, when she decided to sell clothes in the local market. Three and a half years ago, she opened a convenience store in her home.

She is a kind, hard working mother of three children (the youngest is adopted) who struggles daily to give her children the best so they may receive the appropriate education.

She is asking for the loan to purchase goods for the convenience store and to be able to rent the home she wants to build for additional income.

Mr.P. started his mattress business 12 years ago. As the business grew he was able to afford specialized equipment to improve the quality of his goods and services. He currently owns 3 industrial sewing machines, which are used to give a quality finish to the seams. His business is family operated and all his children except the smallest work with him creating and repairing mattresses.

Mr.P. is requesting a loan to allow him to purchase cotton, cloth and other materials to increase production which will allow his family to offer their goods to local retailers.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.name: Lina Maribel

texts.es:
Lina García has three children and 13 years as small business owner. She used to sell clothes, but had to change fields, as taking care of her small children required her to stay at home. Consequently, in 2004 she opened a home-based business selling sodas. She then added a sandwich cart, which constituted an additional source of income, as her house is located right in front of a soccer stadium. Every time she accumulates a capital, she improves her business. Her present goal is to renovate her workplace and convert it into a diner.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Lina García tiene 3 hijos y 13 años como microempresaria. Inicialmente Lina vendía ropa, luego cambió de negocio debido a que sus hijos son menores de edad, por lo que requería de sus cuidados, es así que en el 2004 creó su negocio de venta de gaseosas en su casa. Luego lo complementó comprando un carrito sanguchero, que vió como otra fuente de ingreso, ya que su casa se encuentra ubicada frente a un estadio de fútbol. Lina cada vez que cuenta con capital mejora su negocio; es por ello que su actual meta es remodelar su sitio de trabajo para convertirlo en un comedor.

loans.use: Purchase of containers and boxes for the beverages.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
Mr. C. has run a brick-making shop for eight years. It’s a craft he learned from his father, who used to elaborate mud bricks as well. He started his business with two employees but, as demand grew, he had to hire two more workers. Additionally, he works hard and also delivers his products. He has improved the shop and last year he invested in reinforcing its structure, which was weak. He is making a great effort because he wants to give his son better opportunities than the ones he had.

The loan was granted to purchase raw materials, such as white earth (temlithit), wood and other materials needed for brick making. His goal is to make the most out of the summer, which is the best season for construction.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. C. tiene una ladrillera hace ocho años. Es un oficio que aprendió de su padre, quien también elaboraba ladrillos artesanales. Inició su negocio con dos trabajadores, pero al tener mayor demanda, debió incrementar la cantidad y actualmente cuenta con cuatro trabajadores, junto con él, quien se esfuerza por trabajar y hacer los viajes para repartir sus productos. Ha ido mejorando su ladrillera: el año pasado invirtió en la estructura, que se sentía débil. Su mayor esfuerzo lo hace por que quiere sacar adelante a su hijo y que tenga mejores oportunidades de superación que las que él tuvo.

El crédito se le otorgó para comprar materia prima, tal como tierra blanca, leña y otros insumo necesarios para la elaboración de ladrillos. Su objetivo es poder aprovechar el verano en la elaboración de ladrillos, ya que es la mejor temporada para la construcción.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for brick elaboration, such as white earth (temlithit) and wood.

payments.comment: This entrepreneur prepaid the balance on his loan. He is very grateful for your loan and appreciates your support.

texts.es:
María S. tiene viviendo en huascar 25 años,  tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales 2 son menores de edad y actualmente estudian en el colegio, ellos son la razón de su esfuerzo, sus ganas de mejorar su negocio cada día.
La señora se inicia como microempresaria vendiendo carbón, luego por iniciativa de sus hijos mayores crear un taller de confecciones el cual tiene 2 años.
Actualmente la señora cuenta con 5 máquinas la cual le permite confeccionar y prestar servicios a terceros.
Su proyección es tener un taller mas equipado, es decir contar con 15 maquinas aproximadamente.

María S. tiene viviendo en huascar 25 años,  tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales 2 son menores de edad y actualmente estudian en el colegio, ellos son la razón de su esfuerzo, sus ganas de mejorar su negocio cada día.
La señora se inicia como microempresaria vendiendo carbón, luego por iniciativa de sus hijos mayores crear un taller de confecciones el cual tiene 2 años.
Actualmente la señora cuenta con 5 máquinas la cual le permite confeccionar y prestar servicios a terceros.
Su proyección es tener un taller mas equipado, es decir contar con 15 maquinas aproximadamente.

Maria S. has lived in Huascar 25 years, she is a mother of 7 (two of them underaged and in school). Her children are her life force and the reason she wants to improve her business daily. Her first business venture was selling coal, and later with the initiative of her two eldest sons opened a sewing shop.

They currently have five machines which allow them to sew clothes and provide other services. To be able to reach their objectives, they need to purchase 10 sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es:
This person's family group consists of one son who relies on his dad and his wife who helps with the business. She helps in the store since he also works as a courier; he has 12 years experience in the store and five as a courier. The store got its start with sixty dollars worth of merchandise, financing has helped him get all the things he needs and be able to offer a wide variety of products to his clients. He was not able to offer these because of the lack of resources and financial support. He's had five previous loans and he's paid them to the fullest and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El grupo familiar del solicitante lo componen dos personas un hijo que depende directamente del solicitante y su esposa que le ayuda en el negocio, ya que don Manuel aparte de la tienda se dedica a hacer viajes expresos tiene 12 años de experiencia en el negocio de la tienda y cinco en el de transporte , la tienda la inicio con sesenta dolares en mercadería, los financiamientos con integral le han ayudado para poder ofrecer a sus clientes diversos productos que antes le solicitaban y que por la falta de recursos económicos no podía comprar, a manejado cinco créditos con Apoyo Integral los cuales a manejado puntualmente e invertido en sus negocios .

loans.use: Purchase of consumables such as dairy products, beverages, and basic grains since these are all products in high demand in his area

texts.es:
Maria G. is a native of San Martin, Peru. She has four children of whom only one lives with her. She started as a small business owner by selling candy. As a result of her entrepreneurial spirit, she was able to create another business, selling sandwiches and “salchipapas.” She bought a street cart, working with it everyday starting at 6:30PM, generating another form of income. Maria would like to buy two display cases so that she may sell seasonal articles. It’s worth mentioning that Maria is an amiable, perseverant person who is close with her community.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

María G. es natural de San Martín, departamento del Perú. Tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 1 hijo solo vive con ella. Se inicia como microempresaria vendiendo golosinas. Debido a su espíritu emprendedor pudo formar otro negocio el cual es de venta de sandwiches y salchipapas, se compró un carrito sanguchero. trabajándolo todos los días a partir de las 6:30p.m. generándole otro tipo de ingreso. María proyecta comprar dos vitrinas para poder vender artículos de temporada. Cabe mencionar que María es una persona amable, perseverante y solidaria dentro de su comunidad.

Shortly after their marriage, Delia´s husband became unemployed. She decided to create crafts to sell amongst friends and neighbours. Once her husband found work as a technician, Delia continued with her small business just in case they found themselves in a similar situation again. Slowly she built up her product base, increased sales and added toys and other merchandise that her clients requested.

At present Delia has a backlog of orders that can´t be processed due to a lack of funds. She requests a $950 loan to be repayed in six months to fulfill the orders and avoid losing clients to her competitors.

With your help, Delia will go ahead with her business and in the future be able to hand over control of the operation to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

18 years ago Patricia decided to start selling beauty products to complement her husbands´ meager earnings as a cab driver. She has two children, and an additional salary was necessary to help cover the costs of running her home and to pay for her children´s education. Initially she sold her beauty products to family members, until her neighbors began to discover her excellent merchandise. She acquired a fine reputation as she made it a point to deliver her products quickly.

Currently she does not have enough inventory to meet demand. To be able to purchase stock, Patricia is requesting a $950 loan which will be returned within six months. With your help, Patricia will be able to continue with her business venture and will make enough money to pay for her children´s education.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Đỗ Thị Tuyết is 50 years old and her husband is 52. They have 1 son and 3 daughters who are all grown up. Her husband works as a driver. Ms Tuyết has been participating in TYM fund for the last 8 years, she sells flowers and grocery at the market stand. This type of work is popular amongst the locals who live in the neighborhood of the market. Her income is about 4-5 USD a day. She really wishes to obtain a loan from TYM to be able to offer more variety to her customers. She's requesting a loan of 950 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đỗ Thị Tuyết năm nay 50 tuổi, còn chồng chị 52. Họ có 1 con trai 3 con gái đều đã đến tuổi trưởng thành. Chồng chị là một người lái xe. Chị đã tham gia quỹ TYM được 8 năm nay, công việc chủ yếu của chị là bán hoa quả. Việc bán hàng hoa quả là một nghề phổ biến với người dân tại khu chợ nơi chị Tuyết sinh sống, công việc này thuận tiện cho việc hoàn trả tuần. Tiền lãi hàng ngày chị thu được từ nghề này khoảng 4-5USD. Chị rất muốn vay thêm vốn từ TYM để mua thêm nhiều hàng phục vụ cho người dân. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị lần này là 950USD

loans.use: Buy fruits, merchandise for her store

loans.name: Jorge Francisco

texts.es:
Jorge Francisco began selling snow cones four years ago after he became unemployed. His sister suggested he purchase a small truck to become self-employed. Sales were good and he had to ask his wife and two children to help him with the 4 trucks he purchased to sell snow cones daily.

Since the trucks require maintenance, Jorge is requesting a $475 credit to be returned in six months. He needs the money to maintain the trucks for the beginning of the year and to purchase raw materials to produce his snowcones.

WIth your help, Jorge and his family can move forward and continue with their prosperous snow cone business.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance and purchase of raw materials

texts.vi:
Ms Lê Thị Kiều is 34 years old. She and her husband live in Kim Động, Hưng Yên. They have 2 sons who are attending school. They are woodworkers for the last 5 years. This type of work is popular in the town where they live. They needed capital to buy wood so Ms Kiều has joined TYM fund. Their loan was well invested as it yielded increasing profit as the production increases. They work full time in their shop, they also have 2 employees helping them. Their income is about 125 USD a month. This time she's requesting a loan of 625 USD to stock up on wood thus increase the production.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Kiều năm nay 34 tuổi sống cùng chồng tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Anh chị có 2 người con trai, đều trong độ tuổi đến trường. Gia đình chị làm nghề mộc từ 5 năm nay. Đây là một nghề phổ biến tại vùng nơi gia đình chị Kiều sinh sống. Nghề này đòi hỏi phải có vốn mua gỗ nên chị đã tham gia quỹ TYM. Với vốn vay của quỹ công việc sản xuất kinh doanh của chị Kiều ngày càng thuận lợi. Ngoài lao động chính là 2 vợ chồng, gia đình chị còn thuê thêm 2 nhân công phụ để phụ giúp trong công việc này. Thu nhập bình quân từ nghề mộc là 125USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục xin vay 625USD để có thể mua được nhiều gỗ phục vụ cho việc làm nghề mộc tại gia đình.

Mrs. Lê Thị Tưởng, 32 years of age, has been a member of the TYM Fund for 7 years. Her primary business is trading small merchandise, such as candy, liquor, cigarette etc. Anyone visiting her store would not forget her bright smiling face and her determination of pleasing customers. Her husband, 33, is a farming worker at home also helps her a hand of taking care of the business. All the years Mrs. Tưởng with the TYM Fund, she's been always an exemplary member. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 950USD to buy more merchandise. Her income is 150USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva voluteer.


Chị Lê Thị Tưởng năm nay 32 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ được 7 năm. Công việc chủ yếu của chị là chuyên bán buôn, bán lẻ các loại hàng hóa như bánh kẹo, rượu, thuốc lá và một số mặt hàng khác. Ai đã từng đến cửa hàng kinh doanh của chị Tưởng thì không thể quên được chị bán hàng với khuôn mặt rạng rỡ luôn làm vui lòng khách đến vừa lòng khách đi ấy. Chồng chị năm nay 33 tuổi làm nông nghiệp tại nhà và phụ giúp chị trong công việc kinh doanh. Trong những năm tham gia chị Tưởng luôn là thành viên vay vốn và sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả của Quỹ TYM. Lần này chị muốn đề nghị quỹ cho chị vay 950USD để mua thêm hàng phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh của mình. Mức thu nhập của chị Tưởng hiện nay là 150USD.

Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Cảnh, 49 years of age, her husband 51, has been a member of the TYM Fund for 10 years. They have a son and two daughters. All are grown up. Her husband sells bus tickets, and she tends a small grocery stand at the open market near their house. She’s been having this stand for 11 years now. The daily income is about 4USD. The money flow of this grocery business is convenient for weekly loan repayments. She would like to apply for a loan of 950USD to buy more merchandise. The loan would help her to avoid buying by credit with a much higher interest rate.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Cảnh, một thành viên vào Quỹ 10 năm, năm nay 49 tuổi, còn chồng chị 51. Họ có 1 con trai 2 con gái đều đã trưởng thành. Trong khi chồng chị bán vé xe tại chợ thì chị có một cửa hàng bán hàng tạp hoá nhỏ. Việc bán hàng tạp hoá tại khu chợ nơi gia đình chị Cảnh sinh sống rất thuận lợi cho việc hoàn trả hàng tuần. Mỗi ngày chị Cảnh bán được rất nhiều mặt hàng các loại với tiền lãi hàng ngày là 4USD. Tính đến nay chị Cảnh đã bán hàng được 11 năm. Chị muốn vay thêm 950USD từ Quỹ TYM để mua thêm hàng phục vụ cho người dân và không phải mua chịu từ bên ngoài với lãi suất cao.

Mrs. Nguyen Thi D. is 30 years old and her husband is 44 years old. They have a son and a daughter that are both underage of schooling. While her husband repairs clocks and watches, she does business. Because of advantageous location (in the market), her business continues very well. On average, she profits 4-5 USD/day. This profit helps paying daily living cost and repaying the loan weekly. When her husband has free time, he also helps her with her business. This time, Mrs. D. wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more products to satisfy needs of people in town.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị D. năm nay 30 tuổi, còn chồng chị 44. Họ có 2 con nhỏ 1 trai 1 gái đều chưa đến độ tuổi đến trường. Trong khi chồng chị sửa chữa đồng hồ thì chị bán hàng hóa. Do địa điểm bán hàng thuận lợi (trong chợ) công việc kinh doanh của chị D. diễn ra rất thuận lợi. Trung bình 1 ngày chị lãi 4-5USD. Số tiền lãi này đủ giúp chị trang trải những chi phí hàng ngày và trả tiền tuần. Chồng chị những lúc nhàn rỗi còn giúp chị rất nhiều trong công việc bán hàng. Vòng vốn này chị D. xin vay 950USD để mua được nhiều mặt hàng hơn nữa phục vụ nhu cầu đa dạng của nhân dân trong vùng.
